finding: The rs63750082 variant, which caused a p.Gly206Ala substitution in PSEN1, was identified as a clinical variant. It was notably found in a pair of siblings among the AD cases, highlighting its association with an earlier age of onset of AD relative to noncarriers.
title: Frequency of Variants in Mendelian Alzheimer’s Disease Genes within the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP)

finding: The rs63750219 variant, a deletion in PSEN1, was detected among the clinical variant carriers implicating it in the pathology of AD, although specific phenotypic details were not provided.
title: Frequency of Variants in Mendelian Alzheimer’s Disease Genes within the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP)

finding: The rs63749824 variant, resulting in a p.Ala79Val substitution in PSEN1, was primarily responsible for the higher proportion of PSEN1 carriers in AD cases, emphasizing its relevance in AD development.
title: Frequency of Variants in Mendelian Alzheimer’s Disease Genes within the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP)

finding: The SNP rs7145882, linked to the gene TRAF3, was also found to be causally associated with MS susceptibility. Similar to rs2076343, this finding stemmed from SMR analysis, which indicated that this SNP impacts mRNA expression and protein translation. The association was supported by consistent directional effects in the expression data, highlighting its relevance in the context of MS.
title: Multi-omics integration prioritizes potential drug targets for multiple sclerosis

finding: The missense variant associated with SOS2 was linked to higher FEV1 and showed significant associations with various metabolic traits, indicating potential implications for pulmonary and metabolic health.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: Found near the MIDEAS gene, this variant was significantly associated with increased HbA1c levels, supporting its involvement in T2D pathways.
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: The rs365990 missense variant in the MYH6 gene was noted for its association with spatial strain specifically in the basal lateral wall, presenting a beta value of -0.05. Although not previously associated with left ventricular mass, ejection fraction, or global radial strain in past studies, this newly identified spatial trait association adds significant insight into its role.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac structure and function

finding: The SNP rs74065194 was located approximately 200kb downstream from the SEL1L gene and showed a significant association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) with a meta-analysis P-value of 0.011, indicating a novel link to AD.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals new Alzheimer’s disease-associated rare variants in loci related to synaptic function and neuronal development

finding: A 310 bp deletion overlapping an enhancer in the IGH gene cluster was in LD (R²=0.26) with the SNP rs10131280, possibly influencing Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The rs11156978 variant showed association with impaired glucose tolerance in mouse models, which suggests a potential link to obesity-associated disease mechanisms.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: rs8017642 was identified as an EC-specific caQTL for NEK9. The research revealed that NEK9 was predominantly expressed in endothelial cells enriched with endothelium-to-mesenchymal transition genes, highlighting the variant's role in the endothelial cell dynamics relevant to CAD.
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: The intronic variant rs9323567 within the RGS6 gene on chromosome 14q24.2 was associated with lower PRU values (β: -26.71, 95% CI: -37.27 to -16.15, p=9.85·10^-7). RGS6 is expressed in the heart and regulates ischemic injury.
title: Discovery of Ancestry-specific Variants Associated with Clopidogrel Response among Caribbean Hispanics

finding: Associated with SLC25A21, the SNP rs712329 was confirmed to be significant in influencing PSA levels, marking its importance in genetic research.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs187319135 variant, located upstream of the TCL1B gene, conferred an increased risk for overall CH with an OR of 1.85 [1.53-2.23] and a P-value of 2.69 x 10^-9. Additionally, it was significantly associated with TET2- and SF3B1+SRSF2-specific CH, showing opposing effects on DNMT3A-CH with an OR of 0.31 [0.18-0.55], P = 1.30 x 10^-6.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The rs774615666 variant in the promoter of the TCL1B gene exhibited a strong association with TET2-CH (OR = 4.19 [2.89-6.06], P = 2.77 x 10^-10) and with SF3B1+SRSF2-CH (OR = 16.7 [9.53-29.4], P = 9.15 x 10^-13), highlighting its role in CH risk.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: Mapped to LINC00637, this SNP was identified as significant in the broader context of addiction susceptibility.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The PiZ allele (rs28929474, p.Glu366Lys) was found to be protective against AMD with an odds ratio of 0.81, suggesting its significance in AMD risk modulation.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The PiS allele (rs17580, p.Glu288Val) was associated with an increased risk for AMD (OR=1.10), indicating its potential pathogenic effect.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: Variant rs4904871 in SLC24A4 was associated with hair color traits, demonstrating significant cross-ancestry heterogeneity and providing insight into genetic determinants of pigmentation.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs10220706, downstream of PPM1A, had an effect size of β = 0.06 and MAF of 0.30, linking it to both testosterone and reproductive timing traits.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The rs12882923 variant was identified as a top-ranked risk variant for prostate cancer. It mapped to a POL2RA binding site and influenced the DNA motif of multiple transcription factors in prostate epithelial cells, indicating functional implications for cancer development.
title: GWAS and 3D chromatin mapping identifies multicancer risk genes associated with hormone-dependent cancers

finding: The rs2236007 variant was associated with breast cancer, where the risk g-allele was reported to reduce PAX9 promoter activity by recruiting the suppressive transcription factor EGR1. This alteration was linked to increased breast cancer cell growth, highlighting its role in cancer susceptibility.
title: GWAS and 3D chromatin mapping identifies multicancer risk genes associated with hormone-dependent cancers

finding: The missense variant rs28929474 in <italic>SERPINA1</italic> demonstrated pleiotropic effects with associations to multiple disease categories, and it had a PIP of 0.64, indicating it may also contribute to migraine risk despite being in a low-quality fine-map region.
title: Fine-mapping a genome-wide meta-analysis of 98,374 migraine cases identifies 181 sets of candidate causal variants

finding: The rs28929474 variant, a known pathogenic missense variant in SERPINA1, was reported in the context of its association with VTE risk.
title: Cross-Ancestry Investigation of Venous Thromboembolism Genomic Predictors

finding: The SNP rs17580 was associated with the SERPINA1 gene, which encodes alpha-1-antitrypsin involved in inflammation and coagulation processes. It was identified as a rare missense variant linked to possible impaired protein function, with a high CADD PHRED score of 32, suggesting its potential deleterious effect. This SNP was noted for its possible relationship to fibrinogen levels through pathways influenced by inflammatory responses.
title: Whole genome analysis of plasma fibrinogen reveals population-differentiated genetic regulators with putative liver roles

finding: The SNP rs9671760 was found to be significantly associated with antibody reactivity against the rubella virus, with a P-value of 3.34 × 10^-14, and also against the sandfly fever Sicilian virus, with a P-value of 1.46 × 10^-11. This association indicated that rs9671760 regulates IGHV3-64 usage, an element that is critical for effective antibody responses.
title: Demographic and genetic factors shape the epitope specificity of the human antibody repertoire against viruses

finding: The SNP rs1024350 was associated with antibodies against the rubella virus, showing a P-value of 1.90 × 10^-11. Furthermore, it was suggestively associated with antibody response to influenza A viruses with a P-value of 5.38 × 10^-10. This variant influenced IGHV1-69 usage, which is known to play a role in the quality of anti-influenza antibodies.
title: Demographic and genetic factors shape the epitope specificity of the human antibody repertoire against viruses

finding: The variant rs989909 was associated with mitral valve prolapse and overlapped an enhancer predicted to regulate LTBP2 in all VIC populations, suggesting its impact on valvular interstitial cell function.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The SNP rs57731447 was identified as a gene expression instrument of ENTPD5. Through a two-step Mendelian randomization (MR) approach, the protein level of ENTPD5 was causally linked to four candidate mediators, confirming its role in COVID-19 severity. Subsequent analysis observed substantial evidence of a causal role whereby increased D-dimer levels led to an increase in COVID-19 severity, with an odds ratio of 2.36.
title: Multi-omics study revealing putative drug targets of COVID-19 severity and other viral infection diseases

finding: The SNP rs118113209 was selected as part of the gene expression instruments for ENTPD5. The analysis established significant causal relationships between the protein level of ENTPD5 and various mediators, although the broader investigation into these mediators in relation to COVID-19 severity yielded limited supportive causality. Nonetheless, the SNP contributed to understanding the potential mechanisms linking ENTPD5 expression to COVID-19 severity.
title: Multi-omics study revealing putative drug targets of COVID-19 severity and other viral infection diseases

finding: The lead GWAS SNP rs10143310 was associated with usage of the J1 intron in the ATXN3 gene and was close to genome-wide significance in ALS studies. This SNP correlated with specific CAG repeat lengths of greater than 16 copies, which have implications for ALS risk.
title: Integrative genetic analysis of the amyotrophic lateral sclerosis spinal cord implicates glial activation and suggests new risk genes

finding: The lead QTL SNP rs200388434 showed a strong association with splicing patterns downstream of the CAG repeat in the ATXN3 gene. It demonstrated high linkage disequilibrium (R2 = 0.93) with the GWAS SNP rs10143310, supporting the hypothesis that it may tag common genetic variants related to intermediate length CAG repeats and ALS risk.
title: Integrative genetic analysis of the amyotrophic lateral sclerosis spinal cord implicates glial activation and suggests new risk genes

finding: rs11846938 was identified through fine-mapping as part of the core regulatory region affecting TCL1A and exhibits a very high LD with another significant variant, rs2887399. It was previously discovered as a primary mediator of clonal expansion in CHIP carriers, contributing to mutational burden in the absence of known driver lesions.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: As the lead variant at the TCL1A locus, rs2887399 was recognized for its significant role in clonal expansion in CHIP carriers, related to mutations affecting the core promoter of TCL1A, influencing hematopoietic stem cell dynamics.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: Located upstream of TCL1A, rs112548922 was part of a credible set of causal variants. Its relation to altered mutation burden highlights the potential regulatory influence on TCL1A and clonal expansion processes.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: Included in the fine-mapping analysis of the TCL1A locus, rs1080435 indicated strong associations with clonal hematopoiesis, reinforcing its role in genetic landscapes influencing mutation burdens.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: This variant was identified within the credible set at the TCL1A locus implicating it in clonal expansion effects, further supporting the genetic architecture related to hematologic malignancies.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: Found in the context of the TCL1A locus, rs73350164 was among the causal variants identified related to mutation burden influences in hematopoietic cells.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: This rare variant was linked to increased mutation burden in a comprehensive analysis, indicating its involvement in the genetic architecture of clonal hematopoiesis.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: The SNP rs2295848, located in the intronic region of the DAAM1 gene, was identified as a novel locus associated with retinal fractal dimension (Df) in a large GWAS of 74,434 participants. This finding indicated a significant link between retinal Df and aging processes.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian randomization study implicates inflammaging biomarkers in retinal vasculature, cardiometabolic diseases and longevity

finding: This SNP indicated a secondary association with a nominal P=5.38×10-8 in the CEBPE locus, representing a novel association.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: SNP rs11158314 was concurrently associated with both the risk of prostate cancer and the expression level of SNAPC1 eRNA (SNAPC1e), indicating its dual role in cancer biology.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: The SNP rs1957862 was identified as tagging an ASD-SV located in the LRFN5 gene, which is implicated in synaptic development. This SNP was found in nearly one-third of individuals from both the Miami and AGPC cohorts studied and was shown to be differentially marked with H3K9me3 in male individuals with autism when inherited maternally. This indicated its involvement as an ASD susceptibility locus.
title: Maintenance of Heterochromatin links Chromatin Modifiers and Neurodevelopment in Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs2268458 in intron 1 of the TSHR gene was found to correlate with an increased risk of relapse in Graves’ disease patients who had the CC genotype as compared to those with the TT genotype.
title: Outcome of Graves’ Disease and Associated Genetic Predisposition: A Systematic Review of Literature

finding: SNP rs1122138 was identified with genome-wide significance (p-value = 3.1×10−8) within an intronic region of TCL1A. While it was correlated with the alternate A allele frequency, it did not remain significant when adjusting for the effect of the nearby SNP rs2887399. Prior associations with clonal expansion prevalence were linked to this locus.
title: Determinants of mosaic chromosomal alteration fitness

finding: SNP rs2887399, located in the core promoter of TCL1A, had previously been reported to modulate stem cell expansion in relation to somatic mutations. In this analysis, it negatively correlated with PACER, indicating its significant role in the context of clonal expansion.
title: Determinants of mosaic chromosomal alteration fitness

finding: The SNP rs179247 in the TSHR gene was found to significantly increase the risk of thyroid disorders, with a higher RAF in cases (0.8125) than in controls (0.75) and an OR of 1.444. This suggests that the 'A' allele correlates with heightened susceptibility to thyroid issues and is particularly associated with Graves' disease.
title: SNP Genes Effect on Thyroid Disorders in a Chinese Demographic

finding: The LTBP2 rs117800773 V1506M mutation demonstrated segregation with the Mitral Valve Prolapse (MVP) trait in a large family pedigree. In the study, this mutation was identified as a rare variant with a minor allele frequency of 0.0001 and was associated with a substantial penetrance for MVP, appearing in 10 out of 28 family members. Mouse models carrying the rs117800773 V1506M mutation showed significant phenotypic traits correlating with MVP, establishing the mutation as a potential causative factor for myxomatous degeneration in both human and animal models.
title: Characterization of LTBP2 mutation causing Mitral Valve Prolapse

finding: The SNP rs28929474 in SERPINA1 showed a positive association with N-acetylglucosaminylasparagine levels, further confirmed by its association with cholestasis risk in FinnGen.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs7972 associated with GSTZ1 was linked to maleate levels, indicating its metabolic involvement.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs12886516 related to L2HGDH was associated with 2-hydroxyglutarate, indicating its role in ketone body metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs117689036 was significantly associated with gestational diabetes, exhibiting an odds ratio (OR) of 3.15 and a P-value of 1.46×10^-8. This intronic variant is located in the MDGA2 gene, which is involved in cell adhesion.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: Found to be associated with TSH levels and linked to the thyrotropin receptor gene, suggesting its critical role in thyroid regulation.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The SNP rs2693698 was associated with bipolar disorder (BD). It was noted that leaving out this SNP made the causal effect estimates for BD on poverty statistically significant, with a result of B=0.029 and p=0.046.
title: The impact of poverty on mental illness: Emerging evidence of a causal relationship

finding: The SNP rs10131280 located at the IGH-gene-cluster locus was independently validated, confirming its association with AD risk in a non-European population.
title: First GWAS on Alzheimer’s Disease in Argentina and Chile populations

finding: The rs63750082 SNP (PSEN1 p.G206A) was related to early-onset AD in Hispanics, found to lead to an earlier age of diagnosis (58.6 years) compared to non-carriers (74.7 years).
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The rs35949016 variant served as a sentinel eQTL for the FUT8 gene in blood and was part of a significant association with IgG glycans that remained significant after conditioning on this variant.
title: Exome sequencing reveals aggregates of rare variants in glycosyltransferase and other genes influencing immunoglobulin G and transferrin glycosylation

finding: The study confirmed that the Pi*Z allele (rs28929474) in SERPINA1 was the most common cause of severe Alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency (A1ATD), which is characterized by early-onset emphysema, liver disease, and auto-inflammatory conditions. It was also noted that the clinical manifestations of this allele depend significantly on environmental factors such as smoking and alcohol use, further emphasizing the role of genetic and environmental modifiers in determining the severity of A1ATD.
title: Common genetic variation associated with Mendelian disease severity revealed through cryptic phenotype analysis

finding: This SNP was part of the 47 lead variants from the recent HF GWAS, demonstrating a significant association with heart failure (HF) and concordant direction of effects.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This missense variant in SERPINA1 showed a strong negative association with the VAT/GFAT ratio (beta = -0.16; P = 4.8 x 10^-10), reflecting its potential involvement in adiposity-related cirrhosis risk.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The sleep-significant rs2664299 in the 14q32.2 region was associated with volumes in the left thalamus proper, showing significant overlaps with cognitive performance traits.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs73347525 was identified as the likely causal SNP for the HbA1c signal near DLK1, where the A allele was associated with increased enhancer probability and exhibited a significant link to increased glucose levels and HbA1c. It was found to overlap a beta cell specific ATAC-seq peak.
title: Modeling islet enhancers using deep learning identifies candidate causal variants at loci associated with T2D and glycemic traits

finding: The SNP rs115400838, an upstream variant in SLC38A6, and a missense variant in TRMT5 were associated with idelalisib response, suggesting a role of SLC38A6 as a transporter for the drug or its substrates.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: SNP rs4608241 was identified in a region on chromosome 14 associated with high COVID-19 severity in individuals of Oceanian ancestry, showing significant association with a p-value of 1.2e-07 after correction. This SNP maps to the long noncoding RNA LINC02307, suggesting its involvement in pathways relevant to viral infection and respiratory health.
title: Deconvoluting complex correlates of COVID19 severity with local ancestry inference and viral phylodynamics: Results of a multiomic pandemic tracking strategy

finding: An intronic variant in GPR132, this SNP was associated with modulation of immune response and inflammation, with direct implications for atopic dermatitis.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: The rs959388 variant showed associations with BMI, smoking, and blood pressure, affirming its relation to heart failure risk.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The SNP rs10220464 was significantly associated with lower forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) in children, with a p-value of 2.4×10^-9 and a beta estimate indicating a negative correlation. It showed high linkage disequilibrium with variants in the TDRD9 gene locus on chromosome 14q32.33.
title: Multi-omic association study identifies DNA methylation-mediated genotype and smoking exposure effects on lung function in children living in urban settings

finding: An AM signal located at chr14:80425295:CATAA:C was associated with "Missed abortion/Hydatidiform mole" in HL females with a significant p-value of <3.92×10^-6 and an odds ratio of 3.11. This was linked to the DIO2 gene implicated in thyroid hormone regulation during pregnancy.
title: Systematic comparison of phenome-wide admixture mapping and genome-wide association in a diverse biobank

finding: The rs2296651 (S267F) variant on NTCP (SLC10A1) was inversely associated with chronic hepatitis B and its progression to cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma in patients suffering from chronic hepatitis B.
title: Identification of potential core genes in hepatoblastoma via bioinformatics analysis

finding: The variant rs11845184, located within the SECISBP2L gene, was highlighted as a new putative causal variant for Crohn's disease (CD). It was associated with brain-related tissue expression and differentiation of oligodendrocytes, underlining its potential relevance in CD pathology.
title: Genome-wide fine-mapping improves identification of causal variants

finding: The rs1778366 variant was found to be a significant locus for social isolation in the friend subscale of the LSNS-6. It was located near LINC02315 and LRFN5, with LRFN5 being associated with neurobehavioral traits and psychiatric disorders, and its association was further linked to a higher prevalence of depressive symptoms.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Social Isolation in 63 497 Japanese Individuals from the General Population

finding: The SNP rs7141210 from the imprinted DLK1-MEG3 locus was found to modify the relationship between SHBG and LOY. Specifically, the T/T genotype of rs7141210 was associated with low levels of SHBG in men without LOY but not in those with LOY (P=0.04 for interaction). This indicates a significant interaction between SHBG levels and LOY status that is dependent on the genotype of rs7141210.
title: Age-related loss of the Y chromosome is associated with sex hormone binding globulin and selected drivers of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs11849538 was associated with LOY status, showing a strong relationship with the heterozygous state (OR = 0.83, P = 6.32×10^−34) and homozygous state (OR = 0.63, P = 1.48×10^−16). This SNP had the strongest association with LOY status among the examined SNPs.
title: Age-related loss of the Y chromosome is associated with sex hormone binding globulin and selected drivers of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs8181938, which is associated with the protein MAX, was identified in the deCODE study as being linked with body-related traits including height and forced vital capacity. The MR analysis supported that MAX levels were expected to influence these traits without reverse causation, indicating a scenario of vertical pleiotropy.
title: Integrative proteogenomics study identifies the indirect effect of circulating proteins on 8 diseases via telomere length

finding: The SNP rs34354104, associated with the protein GMPR2, was similarly linked to body-related traits such as mean corpuscular hemoglobin and mean corpuscular volume in the deCODE study. Like rs8181938, MR analysis suggested that GMPR2 levels were also likely to affect these traits without reverse causation, reinforcing the presence of vertical pleiotropy.
title: Integrative proteogenomics study identifies the indirect effect of circulating proteins on 8 diseases via telomere length

finding: The rs2887399-T variant was identified as a new locus significantly increasing risk for DNMT3A CHIP, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.19 (95% CI 1.15-1.23) and a p-value of 1.26 x 10^-22, highlighting its role in clonal hematopoiesis.
title: Germline genomic and phenomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in 323,112 individuals

finding: The rs4900291-T variant was found to significantly reduce the risk for TET2 CHIP, associated with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.78 (95% CI 0.73-0.84) and a p-value of 2.92 x 10^-11, indicating its protective effect against certain forms of CHIP.
title: Germline genomic and phenomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in 323,112 individuals

finding: The SNP rs941576 had been previously identified in Genome-wide Association Studies (GWAS) as associated with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM). The presence of this SNP provided further evidence supporting the role of the 14q32 locus in the pathogenesis of T1DM, correlating with the findings that circulating miRNAs from this locus could distinguish between different T1DM subgroups with distinct clinical characteristics.
title: A set of circulating microRNAs belonging to the 14q32 chromosomic locus identifies two clinically and phenotypically different subgroups of individuals with recent onset Stage 3 type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs2370982 near NRXN3 was identified as being associated with AF and several cardiometabolic traits, highlighting its relevance in the molecular pathways linking AF and cardiometabolic disorders.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: The SNP rs3783820 also served as a common variant associated with both kyphosis and lordosis, highlighting its potential role in the genetic mechanisms underlying spinal curvature.
title: Aging of the Spine: Characterizing genetic and physiological determinants of spinal curvature

finding: The SNP rs75901165, which maps to the IFT43 gene, was also significantly associated with campesterol levels (P=2.64×10^-8). Although not previously associated with sterol levels, it adds new knowledge about genetic factors influencing plant sterol metabolism.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: The study found that the risk allele G of SNP rs10083370 was associated with increased expression of PPP1R13B in the caudate nucleus. This association was contrasted with a slight decrease in expression in the DLPFC, thus providing insights into the brain region-dependent genetic effects associated with schizophrenia.
title: Genetic and environmental regulation of caudate nucleus transcriptome: insight into schizophrenia risk and the dopamine system

finding: The rs1884539 polymorphism at the DLK1-DIO3 ICR, which distinguished paternal and maternal alleles, showed significant DNA methylation differences between ART, subfertility (SF), and control groups. These findings indicated alterations in imprinting processes, potentially contributing to the phenotypic features associated with ART.
title: Genome-wide DNA methylation, imprinting, and gene expression in human placentas derived from Assisted Reproductive Technology

finding: Similarly, the rs75998174 polymorphism, also located at the DLK1-DIO3 ICR, demonstrated significant differences in DNA methylation among the study groups. This observed methylation variability related to parental allele distinctions further supported the assertion of disrupted imprinting stabilization as a consequence of ART and subfertility.
title: Genome-wide DNA methylation, imprinting, and gene expression in human placentas derived from Assisted Reproductive Technology

finding: The SNP rs10130587 was found to be a candidate causal variant for bone density, with a high confidence assignment to osteoblasts as the relevant cell type. The bone morphogenetic protein 4 gene (BMP4), known for its role in bone formation and osteoblast differentiation, was identified as its target gene.
title: Inferring causal cell types of human diseases and risk variants from candidate regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs4444235 found at 14q22.2 showed a significant association with colorectal cancer risk, producing an OR of 1.20 (95% CI: 1.038-1.405, P=0.01451), which aligned with previous studies indicating its relevance.
title: Colorectal Cancer Risk and Ancestry in Colombian admixed Populations

finding: The rs200603922 variant in the PARP2 gene demonstrated a significant association with PrCa risk (p=0.028) in the Australian dataset, indicating its potential role in the base excision repair pathway.
title: Germline sequencing of DNA-damage-repair genes in two hereditary prostate cancer cohorts reveals new disease risk-associated gene variants

finding: A low-frequency stop-gained mutation in TBPL2 (p.Arg331Ter) was identified with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 1.1% in the Finnish population. This variant was significantly associated with female infertility, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 650.1 (p = 4.11×10^-25) and indicating a severe impact as homozygous carriers had significantly fewer offspring compared to other genotypes, averaging 0.16 offspring.
title: Inherited infertility - mapping loci associated with impaired female reproduction

finding: The rs229243 SNP was linked to regulatory effects on SCFD1 as per SMR prioritization along with mQTL/eQTL analyses.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The G allele of rs365990 from the MYH6 gene was associated with slower heart rate and had a frequency higher in long living individuals (LLIs), resulting in 1.725 times increased chances of surviving to older age.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: The SNP rs1152591 was nominated as a likely causal variant in a locus associated with AF, achieving a PIP of 0.41. It was identified in the context of high linkage disequilibrium with other variants but demonstrated significant potential regulatory function in cardiac tissues.
title: Single-cell genomics improves the discovery of risk variants and genes of Atrial Fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs56349439, located at chr14:101168739, had the strongest association with binary mLOY calls across three methods: MosCoverY, PAR-LOY, and mLRRY. This SNP was identified as having the smallest p-value when analyzed using the MosCoverY method, which focuses on detecting mosaic loss of the Y chromosome associated with various health conditions in men.
title: MosCoverY: a new method to estimate mosaic Loss of Y chromosome from NGS sequencing coverage data

finding: At the locus on 14q24.2, rs244620 was associated with febrile seizures and yielded a combined odds ratio of 1.13 (P = 2.35 x 10^-10). It contained the MAP3K9 gene, and was reported as an eQTL influencing the expression of MAP3K9 in various tissues, linking it to altered febrile seizure risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of febrile seizures identifies seven new loci implicating fever response and neuronal excitability genes

finding: In the European ancestry group, rs2887399 in TCL1A was identified as the most significant association with mLOY, with an Odds Ratio of 0.708 and a p-value of 3.18×10^-419, indicating a strong protective effect.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of mosaic loss of chromosome Y in the Million Veteran Program identifies 167 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs1281241634 within the suggestive window near LINC01500 replicated for stroke in T1D with a p-value of 0.03 in the general population.
title: Whole-genome sequencing identifies variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: Demonstrated significant negative interaction with rs17425819 affecting platelet count and showed protective characteristics against polycythemia vera among individuals with the JAK2 46/1 haplotype.

finding: Loss-of-function mutation rs138881435 at PCK2 presented connections to extracellular fluid fraction, indicating its relevance in metabolic processes.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4983559 was associated with AKT1 for HDL cholesterol, confirmed by a cS2G linking score exceeding 0.5, indicating it was part of a functional interpretation regarding cholesterol metabolism.

finding: The SNP rs915057 was linked to ESR2, associated with depression, and this link was supported by the cS2G approach.

finding: The rs117834516 SNP in the FERMT2 locus demonstrated significant association with AD in the PAD analysis (P=4.82e-08), supporting its role in the disease mechanism.

finding: The rs12147883 SNP found on chr.14q32.32 showed a positive association with IgA levels (Beta=0.05, P=5.42×10^-14), and involved TRAF3, linked to class switch recombination in B cells and the regulation of IgA production.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs11621525 in the HIF1A gene was identified as having a protective association with the transition to secondary progressive multiple sclerosis (SP-MS) in both Italian (OR 0.57; P=3.30×10^-6) and Swedish cohorts (rs1951795, OR 0.79; P=0.0079). Carriers of the protective A allele exhibited reduced HIF1A expression in immune cells, lower plasma/cerebrospinal fluid neurofilament levels, and decreased inflammation and acute axonal injury in post-mortem spinal cord samples. This revealed that the A allele could favor earlier resolution of smoldering inflammation in lesions, which was associated with smaller lesion volumes.
title: Genetic variation in HIF1A is associated with smoldering inflammation and disease progression in Multiple Sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs1951795 was associated with a reduced risk of SP-MS transition in the Swedish cohort (OR 0.79; P=0.0079). It was in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs11621525 (r2=0.98), supporting that it serves as a proxy for the same protective signal. Further, carriers of the A allele exhibited lower neurofilament levels after dimethyl fumarate treatment, indicating a potentially enhanced therapeutic response.
title: Genetic variation in HIF1A is associated with smoldering inflammation and disease progression in Multiple Sclerosis

finding: This lead variant near BMP4 was associated with cervical disc disorders and hernia with a significance of p<1 x 10^-5, contributing to the understanding of its impact on AMH regulation and its interactions with health conditions.
title: Circulating anti-Müllerian hormone levels in pre-menopausal women: novel genetic insights from a GWAS meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs370565192 was also identified for the first time in association with neck or shoulder pain, achieving a p-value of 3.80 x 10^-8, located in the DCAF5 gene on chromosome 14. This finding represents a significant advancement in identifying genetic variants related to the condition.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Neck or Shoulder Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: <italic>GCH1</italic> rs11158026 was significantly associated with striatal binding ratios in bilateral striatum with a coefficient of <italic>β</italic> = -0.16 and <italic>p</italic> value of 0.0002, indicating its relevance in clinical assessments for PD.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: The rs12885387 SNP, located within the 14q24.2 region, was identified as a significant intronic variant of the RGS6 gene for albuminuria. It played a crucial role in the initial association mapping and was supported by findings in conditional admixture mapping.
title: Admixture mapping screening of CKD traits and risk factors in U.S. Hispanic/Latino individuals from Central America country-of-origin

finding: The rs2360982 SNP was identified as a deleterious variant associated with albuminuria, demonstrating relevance in the regulatory context due to its involvement in epigenetic features that affect kidney function.
title: Admixture mapping screening of CKD traits and risk factors in U.S. Hispanic/Latino individuals from Central America country-of-origin

finding: The rs3813547 SNP was highlighted as a deleterious variant within the 14q24.3 locus, reflecting similar regulatory associations as rs2360982, and was implicated in hypertension and albuminuria.
title: Admixture mapping screening of CKD traits and risk factors in U.S. Hispanic/Latino individuals from Central America country-of-origin

finding: The rs2543380 SNP was among those predicted to be deleterious in the 14q24.3 region and contributed to the locus's association with albuminuria, regulatory function, and epigenetic features in kidney tissue.

finding: Situated at the ASPG locus, rs1744294 was found to decrease the level of aspartic acid (Asp) by -0.13, reinforcing its significance in amino acid metabolism.

finding: The association with SNP rs1744297 was explored for its influence on various amino acids.

finding: The rs33912345 variant in the SIX6 locus was identified as a significant risk factor for primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG). This missense variant was linked to lower expression levels of the SIX6 and SALRNA1 genes, suggesting that it contributes to the etiology of POAG by downregulating these genes. Additionally, it was found to interact with variants in the CDKN2B-AS1 locus, affecting the expression of CDKN2A and CDKN2B, indicating a complex regulatory role in POAG related to vascular traits.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The proxy SNP rs7493429, which is in high linkage disequilibrium with rs33912345, was linked to significant gene expression changes in the SIX6 locus. It was found to influence expression patterns relative to the presence of the rs33912345 risk allele.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: This SNP was associated with non-AD inflammation in females (+1.39SD), showing a significant genetic effect that was absent in males.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs979812 was previously identified in GWAS studies as being associated with Parkinson's disease and was shown to have a significant positive association with increased GalCase activity (b=1.2; se=0.06; p=5.10E-95). Additionally, this SNP was linked with higher expression levels of the GALC gene, indicating that its effects contributed to both increased GalCase activity and expression in Parkinson's disease.
title: GALC variants affect galactosylceramidase enzymatic activity and risk of Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs398607, which encodes a non-synonymous variant p.I562T, was associated with increased GalCase activity (b=1.65, se=0.05, p=2.70E-242). Although associated with Parkinson's disease, it did not reach GWAS significance on its own (b=-0.05, se=0.01, p=1.51E-06), but it is recognized as having an impactful role in modifying GalCase enzymatic activity.
title: GALC variants affect galactosylceramidase enzymatic activity and risk of Parkinson’s disease

finding: This SNP reached suggestive significance in the analysis related to bilateral clefts, with a p-value of 8.07×10⁻⁸, and has been previously implicated in syndromes with facial dysmorphisms, linking it to the etiology of facial defects.

finding: This lead SNP was associated with descending aortic distensibility and was related to the FBLN5 gene.

finding: The SNP rs147021911 was strongly associated with ER-negative breast cancer. finding: The SNP rs34485356 was found at chromosome 14q32.2 and was associated with angioedema at a genome-wide significance level. Furthermore, it was associated with significant reductions in systolic and diastolic blood pressure per T allele, specifically a decrease of -0.46 mmHg for systolic and -0.26 mmHg for diastolic blood pressure, with both findings statistically significant.

finding: The rs28929474 SNP, located in the SERPINA1 region, was associated with circulating sclerostin levels, presenting an SD change per T allele with P value of 1.1 × 10^-10.

finding: The rs57645874 SNP was associated with Elision in CFSRS with a p-value of 1x10^-6, and with reading accuracy measured by NARA-A in ALSPAC with a p-value of 0.02. This SNP also corresponds to an meQTL, rs4981288, linked to the methylation marker cg07166546.

finding: The rs856379 SNP was associated with MSW in CFSRS with a p-value of 3x10^-6 and with nonword reading in ALSPAC (ALSPACread) where it attained a p-value of 0.036. It was identified as an meQTL for the methylation marker cg13972423, further supporting its relevance to neural functions.
title: Association between genes regulating neural pathways for quantitative traits of speech and language disorders

finding: The rs1257267 SNP showed an association with WRMT-AT in CFSRS with a p-value of 6.58x10^-6 and with nonsense word repetition (CNrep5) in ALSPAC with a p-value of 0.05. This finding provided a genetic explanation for hypothyroxinemia during early pregnancy despite hCG stimulation.
title: Genome-wide association studies of thyroid-related hormones, dysfunction, and autoimmunity among 85,421 Chinese pregnancies

finding: In the study, it was found that SNP rs112806369, which corresponds to the IGHV1-2 alleles A*02 and A*04, influenced the frequencies of vaccine-induced B cell responses. Specifically, allele A*02 was associated with stronger VRC01-class responses compared to A*04. The difference in response frequency was suggested to be primarily due to higher B cell frequencies associated with the A*02 genotype in the naive repertoire. The study documented that the mutation at this SNP, leading to an amino acid change (Arg66 to Trp66), was favored in VRC01-class maturation in A*04 homozygous individuals, which may have contributed to the observed BCR ratios favoring A*02 in heterozygous individuals.
title: Human immunoglobulin gene allelic variation impacts germline-targeting vaccine priming

finding: Identified as the second hit in the analysis, this SNP in the AKAP6 gene showed a unique pattern where risk for depression decreased with increased stressful life events (P = 1.2 × 10^-8).
title: Genome-wide by environment interaction study of stressful life events and hospital-treated depression in the iPSYCH2012 sample

finding: The SNP rs1111179 was identified as part of mQTL associations with neuropsychiatric disorders, specifically associated with Major Depressive Disorder (MDD). It was linked to the mQTL-CpG cg10318063, with significant original GWAS p-values reported.
title: Potentially causal associations between placental DNA methylation and schizophrenia and other neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs61990289 was also recognized as significant in the context of MDD, associated with the mQTL-CpG cg23217097. It demonstrated strong connections to original GWAS statistics, reinforcing its relevance.
title: Potentially causal associations between placental DNA methylation and schizophrenia and other neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: The variant rs7141210 exhibited a maternal-specific association with platelet counts and replicated a previously reported association seen in the Icelandic population, connecting it to associated methylation patterns.
title: Genome-wide survey of parent-of-origin specific associations across clinical traits derived from electronic health records

finding: The variant rs2268616 was significant in both joint tests for sex (p=2.67×10⁻⁸) and cardiometabolic diseases (p=3.87×10⁻⁸). It influenced severe COVID-19 outcomes, showing stronger effects in males (OR=1.79) and individuals with type 2 diabetes (T2D) (OR=2.01). This intronic variant in the PGF gene has been associated with testosterone and is an eQTL for EIF2B2, suggesting it modifies biological responses, particularly in males and those with T2D.
title: Gene-environment interaction analysis incorporating sex, cardiometabolic diseases, and multiple deprivation index reveals novel genetic associations with COVID-19 severity

finding: The SNP rs6571361 was associated with SCFD1 and showed strong evidence of significance with a P-value of 2.54×10−7 and a false discovery rate (FDR) of 3.48×10−2. This finding related to the shared genetic architecture between inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Neurodegenerative Disorders: Integrated Evidence from Mendelian Randomization, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs10136727 was also associated with SCFD1, displaying a P-value of 3.81×10−7 and an FDR of 4.64×10−2, indicating its role in the shared genetic loci for IBD and ALS.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Neurodegenerative Disorders: Integrated Evidence from Mendelian Randomization, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs7154847 was linked to G2E3 with a P-value of 4.46×10−7 and an FDR of 2.70×10−2. This SNP was noted for its significance in the shared genetic network between IBD and ALS.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Neurodegenerative Disorders: Integrated Evidence from Mendelian Randomization, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs447853 was associated with G2E3, showing a P-value of 9.58×10−7 and an FDR of 3.45×10−2. This finding further supported the shared genetic architecture connecting IBD and ALS.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Neurodegenerative Disorders: Integrated Evidence from Mendelian Randomization, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: This SNP was linked to Alzheimer's disease (AD) with a very strong association (P=2×10^-12), indicating its relevance in the genetic underpinnings of the condition.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs2749527, located at the SERPINA1/6 locus on chromosome 14, was associated with significantly reduced plasma cortisol levels (p=1.75e-13) and significantly reduced CST3 gene expression in visceral adipose tissue in the STARNET cohort (p=0.002448 in additive model, p=9.21e-6 in recessive model). Additionally, this variant displayed independent significant associations with reduced liver SERPINA6 expression across both STARNET (p=4.73e-9) and GTEx (p=0.004) cohorts. These findings established a genetic link between cortisol-binding globulin, plasma cortisol, and Cystatin C production, underscoring the role of rs2749527 in mediating the effects of glucocorticoids on Cystatin C levels.
title: Cystatin C is a glucocorticoid response gene predictive of cancer immunotherapy failure

finding: The SNP rs2144530, an intronic variant of SEC23A, exhibited interaction effects with lifestyle behaviors in multiple-interaction models, suggesting its involvement in the genetic architecture of vitamin D status.
title: Improved characterization of gene-environment interactions for vitamin D through variance quantitative trait loci

finding: The deletion variant rs200410709, targeting the intergenic region adjacent to STXBP6, was significantly associated with increased risk of laryngeal cancer, showing an odds ratio of 3.38 (95% CI: 2.26, 5.07, p=3.57×10^-9).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: SNP rs58734839 was an intronic variant in LRFN5 identified as a novel GWS locus in AUD analysis.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs398652 was noted to correlate with a lower risk of bladder cancer, demonstrating its potential protective role as identified in the reviewed studies.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The p.Ser185Cys variant in TRMT5 was significantly associated with multiple stroke phenotypes (e.g., Stroke excluding subarachnoid hemorrhage, p=1.90×10^-4).
title: Novel protein-altering variants associated with serum apolipoprotein and lipid levels

finding: The SNP rs945270 was previously linked to increased KTN1 expression in the frontal cortex, putamen, and blood tissues. This association was suggested to correspond with a larger putamen gray matter volume (GMV) in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients, hinting at KTN1's functional role in PD development.
title: A genetic and transcriptomic assessment of the KTN1 gene in Parkinson’s disease risk

finding: The rs79509284 variant was also significant in the eQTL analysis for KTN1 mRNA expression in the putamen, showing potential regulatory implications for KTN1 without a definitive association with PD.
title: A genetic and transcriptomic assessment of the KTN1 gene in Parkinson’s disease risk

finding: Associated with an increased risk of DNMT3A-CHIP with an odds ratio of 1.14 and a highly significant p-value.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: This SNP was linked to a higher risk of DNMT3A-CHIP, showing an effect size of 1.14 with significant statistical support.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: It was associated with increased risk of DNMT3A-CHIP with a confirmed odds ratio of 1.14.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs200581586 showed shared genetic influences with educational attainment, with potential impacts on cognitive development.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4982712 was associated with cognitive ability and educational attainment, highlighting its relevance to complex traits.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4983416 in the MTA1 gene displayed notable frequency differences: 0.228 in UKB-AFR contrasted with 0.983 in UKB-EUR (p = 9.49 x 10^-322), highlighting its potential relevance to disease risk disparities between populations.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: SNP rs10873538 was linked to the downregulation of EIF5 and PP1R13B, alongside the upregulation of KLC1. This finding contributed to the understanding of how common risk variants might influence expression patterns among key genes implicated in schizophrenia-related neurodevelopmental pathways.
title: Single-cell multi-cohort dissection of the schizophrenia transcriptome

finding: The rs227422 SNP, a missense variant of the inositol polyphosphate-5-phosphatase A (INPP5A) gene, was associated with lower system segregation. It plays a role in controlling intracellular calcium signaling.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: The minor allele (G) at rs365990 was significantly associated with an increase in mean heart rate and a decrease in interday heart rate variation. This SNP, located in exon 25 of MYH6, had previous links to atrial fibrillation and resting heart rate and demonstrated significant enrichment of chromatin features in heart tissues. Additionally, the G allele was enriched in a bipolar/psychotic disorder cohort, which included youths meeting criteria for bipolar or unspecified psychotic spectrum disorder, known for irregular heart activity. Importantly, rs365990 is also an eQTL for CMTM5, which is expressed in brain regions associated with stress response.
title: Digital phenotyping from wearables using AI characterizes psychiatric disorders and identifies genetic associations

finding: Located at 14q22.2, this SNP was recognized as a unique region associated specifically with TBS, suggesting it plays a distinct role in bone microarchitecture beyond shared associations with BMD.
title: Genetic Determinants of Bone Microarchitecture and its Association with Health Outcomes: A Genome-wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study on Trabecular Bone Score

finding: The nonsynonymous variant rs4934 in the SERPINA3 gene was also reported to have a role in promoting resilience against LOAD in APOE-ε4 carriers. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic resilience factors that might modulate genetic risk established by cumulative effects of risk-associated alleles.
title: Polygenic resilience scores capture protective genetic effects for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: rs61975852 exhibited a significant association with WorstEpisode symptom A2 (anhedonia) with an odds ratio of 1.07 and P-value of 3.48×10⁻⁸; this SNP also showed a significant association with the corresponding PHQ9 A2 symptom, P-value = 0.006, indicating its relevance in both symptom assessments.
title: Polygenic analyses show important differences between MDD symptoms collected using PHQ9 and CIDI-SF

finding: The SNP rs28692724, a synonymous variant in IRF2BPL, was significantly associated with hip circumference adjusted for BMI (HIPadjBMI) after meta-analysis with a European sample, highlighting its role in female reproductive functions.
title: Genome-wide association study of body fat distribution traits in Hispanics/Latinos from the HCHS/SOL Study

finding: The SNP rs28929474 exhibited a high CADD score of 20.2, suggesting its potential for deleterious effects in the development of both metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease (MAFLD) and coronary artery disease (CAD). This marks it as a crucial pleiotropic locus influencing these diseases.
title: Genome-wide insights into the shared genetic landscape between metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease and cardiovascular diseases

finding: This SNP implicated the novel gene RTL1, which is associated with muscle regeneration and was found significantly associated with asthma risk in the meta-analysis.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: SNP rs176324 correlated with cooking time, where GA genotypes had longer cooking times compared to GG. This SNP represents a significant association revealed in the analysis and highlights genetic factors influencing the preparation quality of yam.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: The SNP rs150526114 was identified as a tag SNP within a highly differentiated region at the immunoglobulin heavy chain (IGH) locus, showing a frequency of 91% in CDX populations, 73% in KHV populations, and 59% in CHS populations. This allele matched sequences observed in Neanderthal genomes, indicating a Neanderthal-introgressed origin. The allele exhibited extreme frequency differentiation specific to Southeast Asian populations.
title: Local adaptation and archaic introgression shape global diversity at human structural variant loci

finding: This intergenic variant for TAA near FRMD6 achieved significance with a p-value of 2.19x10^-8 and an OR of 4.23.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: The SNP rs1351618 showed a moderate probability of causality (0.390) for post-FVC at locus 5, being located in an intron of the gene EGLN3. Similar to rs10857225, this SNP had a significantly higher minor allele frequency in populations of African ancestry at 12.4%, compared to less than 2.2% in other populations.
title: Integrative genomic analysis in African American children with asthma finds 3 novel loci associated with lung function

finding: The SNP rs365990 was associated with two traits in opposite directions, aiding in the understanding of blood pressure phenotypes.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: The SNP rs221902 was linked to elevated transcript levels of PCNX1 in fetal and adult tissues, emphasizing its role in ASD-related genetic expression.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: The rs12881760 variant disrupted a CTCF binding site and was associated with differences in expression of a cluster of 12 miRNAs, showing high frequency in European populations and a significant signature of positive selection, indicating its adaptive evolution.
title: Population variation of miRNAs and isomiRs and their impact on human immunity to infection

finding: Rs11158026 was confirmed to exhibit strong associations with GCH1, which showed specific expression in dopaminergic neurons, highlighting its potential role in PD.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, aging and disease

finding: The SNP rs999737 was noted in the study as a risk variant for breast cancer, included in the analysis blocks along with other significant SNPs.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Identified as an additional significant association with breast cancer risk associated with RAD51B.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: XRCC3 rs1799794 was associated with an increased risk of neutropenia in patients, indicating its importance in predicting potential adverse effects of chemotherapy in colorectal cancer patients.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The rs8984 variant was associated with an increased prevalence of the long transcript isoform of the CHURC1 gene, which was thought to result from the destruction of a microRNA binding site recognized by the miR-582-5p family.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs59228823 was found to interact with the MEG3 gene, demonstrating fibroblast-specific expression patterns linked to vascular function in arterioles.
title: Chromatin interaction maps of human arterioles reveal new mechanisms for the genetic regulation of blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs12889775 was associated with the expression of both IRF2BPL and the lncRNA RP11-7F17.7. It was predicted to influence the epromoter's binding affinity for EGR1, exhibiting a high posterior probability of shared association with the expression of these proximal and distal genes.
title: Functional effects of variation in transcription factor binding highlight long-range gene regulation by epromoters

finding: This SNP contributed to the data supporting the genetic overlap between MS and CD.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: The SNP rs217669, located on human chromosome 14, was reported to be associated with the gene SYT16. Using a synteny approach, a cluster 7 DInt was identified with the promoter of a related non-coding RNA that suggested a novel candidate gene for obesity.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: The SNP rs8005161 was associated with the G protein-coupled receptor GPR65 (TDAG8), which was reported to have a significant impact on pH-associated activation during intestinal inflammation. This finding indicated a functional role of this SNP in modulating inflammatory responses, reflecting its relevance in pathophysiological processes.
title: Activation of a nerve injury transcriptional signature in airway-innervating sensory neurons after lipopolysaccharide induced lung inflammation

finding: The SNP rs8020128 was associated with findings related to seasonal variation in the NDVI–species richness relationship in a prairie grassland experiment. This study emphasized the ecological impacts of drought and the role of environmental factors such as relative humidity and temperature, which were crucial for understanding drought effects on plant communities.
title: Simulating atmospheric drought: Silica gel packets dehumidify mesocosm microclimates

finding: The rs229188 variant was linked to women's ageing genetics, suggesting a role in the metabolic changes associated with aging in females, which may influence carcinogenesis.
title: Sex-dependent pathways in hepatocarcinogenesis triggered by deregulated cholesterol synthesis

finding: Related to increased H3K27ac peak height within a SYNE2 intron, this SNP also correlated to increased gene expression of SYNE2.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The rs8007846 SNP, located on chromosome 14, was positively associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) in the context of genomic regions that were enriched for MS-associated GWAS variants. This SNP was identified within a super-enhancer region derived from experiments on CD19+ B cells, suggesting its relevance in the transcriptional regulation of MS through interactions with DNA binding regions of molecular transducers.
title: GWAS associated Variants, Non-genetic Factors, and Transient Transcriptome in Multiple Sclerosis Etiopathogenesis: a Colocalization Analysis

finding: This SNP was positively identified in the context of ecological measurements of coral reefs and was associated with advancements in semi-automated field image collection and analysis techniques, enhancing the understanding of coral reef dynamics.
title: RECIFS: a centralized geo-environmental database for coral reef research and conservation

finding: This SNP was part of a significant review concerning remote sensing of coral reefs for monitoring and management, indicating its relevance in analyzing reef health and environmental conditions.
title: RECIFS: a centralized geo-environmental database for coral reef research and conservation

finding: The derived T allele of rs2273626 in hsa-miR-4707-3p was associated with a neuroprotective role against glaucoma. It showed a frequency of approximately 3% in African populations, significantly higher than in non-Africans (>50%). This association correlated with the higher glaucoma incidence observed in African populations, suggesting positive selection processes for this SNP since the Out-of-Africa event.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: Association was noted for rs61992671 in hsa-miR-412-3p, indicating its potential role in different cancers, as it showed a significant link to gene expression variations.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: This SNP was found to be trans-associated with the gene CPEB2 in the liver in connection with cortisol levels. The network regulated by CPEB2 showed a significant number of causal interactions and was linked to gene networks affected by cortisol.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: This SNP was associated with the gene RNF13, which was identified as a key regulator in a major subcutaneous fat sub-network, encompassing 215 gene targets linked to cortisol.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: This SNP was trans-associated with the transcription factor IRF2 in subcutaneous fat and was shown to regulate a network of genes, some of which are implicated in cardiovascular health.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs8020087 was associated with plant traits observed in a study by Chadwick and Asner in 2016, where they focused on organismic-scale remote sensing of canopy foliar traits in tropical forests, providing insights into ecological applications.
title: Predicting leaf traits across functional groups using reflectance spectroscopy

finding: This SNP was identified as a missense mutation that regulates different eGenes in each tissue. It was associated with neurodevelopment, evolution, or disease, contributing to the relationship between genetic variation and neuronal phenotypes.
title: Derived Homo sapiens cis-eQTL regulation: implications for brain evolution

finding: The SNP rs63750082, which is the PSEN1-G206A mutation, was identified as a rare variant primarily in Puerto Ricans with early onset Alzheimer's disease (EOAD). It had an allele frequency of 0.001 in the 1000 Genome Project reference panel but was absent in the Haplotype Reference Consortium (HRC) reference panel. The imputation for this SNP using the 1000G panel resulted in an IMPUTE2 'info' score of 0.48, which improved to 0.94 when the chunk size was increased to 5MB. Twelve individuals identified as G206A carriers through imputation were subsequently genotyped, and all were confirmed to be mutation carriers, indicating a perfect imputation prediction with 100% agreement.
title: Rare variants imputation in admixed populations: Comparison across reference panels and bioinformatics tools

finding: The SNP rs76341705 at 14q23.1 was found to be associated with the CSA of the lingual gyrus. This association adds to the genetic understanding of cortical surface area traits.
title: Genetic Determinants of Cortical Structure (Thickness, Surface Area and Volumes) among Disease Free Adults in the CHARGE Consortium

finding: The SNP rs56329719 was adjacent to rs56375606 and contributed to the significant modifier effect (14ABEM1) regarding CAG expansion, underscoring the impact of genetic variations in the MLH3 region.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs175016 was highlighted for reducing MLH3 expression, associated with the strong linkage to decreased CAG expansion in Huntington's disease, emphasizing its role in genetic modulation.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs12879725, associated with hastening age at motor onset, was significant in influencing clinical outcomes for Huntington's disease progression.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs175438 correlated with suggestive significant signals impacting the age at TFC6, supporting the connection between genetic modifiers and disease progression.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs10139154, located within the SCFD1 gene, was identified as associated with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) in a study involving a Chinese cohort. This finding highlighted a notable genetic contribution to the disease, establishing a link between this specific variant and ALS risk.
title: Partitioning the genetic architecture of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs2025009, related to RAD51B, was mentioned in connection with DNA repair mechanisms crucial for AML, linking it to cancer progression.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The SNP rs1042704, located in the <italic>MMP14</italic> gene, was also found to be significantly associated with AIS in the broader cohort analysis, demonstrating an OR of 1.239 (P=1.89E-05). However, it did not show significance when the analysis was focused on females.
title: Association of an estrogen-sensitive Pax1-Col11a1-Mmp3 signaling axis with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis

finding: At the MYH6 locus, a novel predicted damaging missense variant (rs28711516, p.Gly56Arg) was discovered. MYH6 had been previously linked to PR interval duration, sick sinus syndrome, atrial fibrillation (AF), and various other cardiovascular traits.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of the electrocardiographic PR interval identifies 210 loci underlying cardiac conduction

finding: The study found that the risk allele T of SNP rs11160538 was associated with higher expression of AL160313. In males, higher expression was linked to a protective role against atherosclerosis, making it a relevant finding for CAD.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: The SNP rs2295682 was identified as an sQTL for the gene RBM23, which is shared across 46 tissues and showed a larger effect in brain subregions such as the cortex. This SNP significantly affected the relative abundances of alternative splice isoforms of RBM23, where individuals with the GG genotype expressed RBM23-002 preferentially, while AA homozygotes expressed RBM23-003. Heterozygotes exhibited intermediate abundance levels.
title: Identification and analysis of splicing quantitative trait loci across multiple tissues in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs10498633 was noted to be associated with AD, linked to the gene RIN3. This association arose because RIN3 is identified in a region tagged by this significant GWAS SNP, further supporting its relevance in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Identification of novel Alzheimer’s disease genes co-expressed with TREM2

finding: The LGALS-3 (rs4652) gene variant was associated with coronary artery disease risk in diabetics, indicating a potential genetic risk factor.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs3759601 located in the gene ATG2B was previously associated with both the in-vitro and in-vivo training effect of Bacillus Calmette-Guérin (BCG) therapy. The analysis indicated a significant influence of this genetic variation on the response of non-muscle invasive bladder cancer (NMIBC) patients to BCG treatment, as highlighted by the Nijmegen Bladder Cancer Study (NBCS). This established the SNP as an important factor in understanding variability in patient outcomes following BCG therapy.
title: Intravesical BCG in patients with non-muscle invasive bladder cancer induces trained immunity and decreases respiratory infections

finding: As a trans-interchromosomal eQTL, rs12894780 was found to interact with the LIPC gene, which suggests it plays a role in the gene regulatory networks associated with COPD.
title: De novo discovery of traits co-occurring with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The association between rs2234919 (p.Pro52Thr) in TSHR and hyperthyroidism was identified, with statistical significance (p=3.6×10⁻⁷, OR=0.74, 95% CI: 0.66-0.83). This finding was consistent with previous conflicting studies.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs7143400 variant located in the 3'UTR of FERMT2 was identified as a genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease (AD). The presence of the T allele facilitated miR-4504 binding, leading to decreased FERMT2 expression, which in turn altered APP metabolism and increased Aβ production. This association was further supported by the observation that miR-4504 was over-expressed in the brains of AD patients.
title: Alzheimer’s genetic risk factor FERMT2 (Kindlin-2) is regulated by risk allele-binding of miR-4504 and leads to synaptic dysfunction in an APP-dependent manner

finding: The SNP variant rs2242542 G/A, located at the splice acceptor AG sequence of the TRAV26-2 V exon, was found to significantly impact splice site functionality, with the A variant removing the splice site. It was present at a frequency of 29.1% in the analyzed 1KGP cases, indicating its relevance in loss of TRAV26-2 expression.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: The SNP rs17113205 was noted to cause a stop codon in the TRAV19 gene, contributing to expression loss. Its association with non-functional alleles resulted in low-level expression being detectable, which demonstrated the impact of this variant in TCR repertoire.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: This SNP, caused a stop codon in the TRAV34 gene, led to hemizygous expression loss, indicating its role in inhibiting the function of specific TCR genes as shown in the analysis.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: The G/A variant rs62622786 influenced recombination signal sequences in the TRAJ12 gene, leading to its expressed loss in homozygous cases. This was particularly notable among African individuals and affected MAIT cell responses.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: The rs3841038 AAGT/− deletion variant removed the splice donor site of TRAJ17, resulting in significant reductions in gene expression in hemizygous or homozygous individuals, which had implications for TCR functionality.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: This variant was associated with low-level expression of a shortened TRAJ52 sequence. The hemizygous expression loss indicated the role of genetic variants in modulating TCR gene expression.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: The T SNP variant was present at a frequency of 1.7% among African individuals analyzed and was associated with a specific TRAV allele, helping in understanding population-level variations in TCR.
