title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: This SNP was validated in the WHI African American sample, showing an association with eGFR, having a p-value of 0.02 and the European ancestry background reflected a similar direction of effect as observed in HCHS/SOL.
title: Genome-wide admixture mapping of eGFR and CKD identify European and African ancestry-of-origin loci in U.S. Hispanics/Latinos

finding: This SNP was associated with eGFR in the WHI African American cohort, with results indicating significance (p-value of 0.02) and similar effect magnitude to the findings from HCHS/SOL.
title: Genome-wide admixture mapping of eGFR and CKD identify European and African ancestry-of-origin loci in U.S. Hispanics/Latinos

finding: The SNP rs144567652, a nonsense mutation in the FANCM gene (c.5791C>T), was found to induce exon skipping, negatively impacting DNA repair activity. This mutation was identified as a familial breast cancer risk factor, emphasizing its significance in understanding genetic predispositions to cancer.
title: FANCM regulates repair pathway choice at stalled replication forks

finding: The sequence variant rs7155603, located upstream of the human Batf gene, was identified in genome-wide association study (GWAS) analyses as being associated with a higher risk for rheumatoid arthritis. This finding is relevant as IFN I is implicated as a pathogenic factor in rheumatoid arthritis, thus establishing a connection between the SNP and autoimmune disease processes involving BATF.
title: BATF controls IFN I production via DC-SCRIPT in plasmacytoid dendritic cells

finding: The study conducted by Casillas et al. in 2018 highlighted the prevalence of the rs2296651 polymorphism within a Spanish population, particularly in the context of hepatitis B virus preS1 variability. The finding suggested a significant relationship between this SNP and variations in the hepatitis B virus, emphasizing its potential relevance in the field of infectious diseases and genetic susceptibility.
title: Significance of hydrophobic and charged sequence similarities in sodium-bile acid cotransporter and vitamin D-binding protein macrophage activating factor

finding: SNP rs77653640 was associated with reduced SA in ADHD, establishing its genetic implications.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs10142766 showed strong correlations with increased thickness in the supramarginal cortex in depressive disorder, further implicating its role.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs911552 was associated with increased thickness in the supramarginal cortex in MDD, illustrating its relevance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs28929474, associated with the SERPINA1 gene (Pi-Z allele), caused a 2.5% increase in ALT and a 1.3% increase in AST, linking it to alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency and its effects on liver function.
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: The SNP rs72691418 was linked to an upregulation of L1 family gene sets. GSEA highlighted its strong positive association with TE family gene expression, further suggesting a regulatory role in transposable element dynamics.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate Regulators of LINE-1 RNA Levels in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The SNP rs72680543 in the 5' region of BMP4 showed a significant association with a p-value of 0.043, but it was in complete linkage disequilibrium with two non-significant SNPs, leading to a lack of follow-up on this finding.
title: Mutation in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and human to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: The SNP rs2887399 was associated with higher expression of the TCL1A gene in blood. The study reported that leukocytes with LOY showed significantly increased TCL1A expression, establishing a clear relationship between this genetic variant and cellular mechanisms that could advantage cancerous conditions.
title: Genetic predisposition to mosaic Y chromosome loss in blood is associated with genomic instability in other tissues and susceptibility to non-haematological cancers

finding: The rs2738413 SNP was associated with the SYNE2-AF region, which was found to activate gene expression in HL-1 mouse atrial cardiomyocytes. This region's activity correlated with AF risk and influenced the expression of SYNE2 in the human atria, showing a functional relationship between this SNP and cardiac gene regulation.
title: Systematic in vivo interrogation identifies novel enhancers and silencers associated to Atrial Fibrillation

finding: Similar to rs2738413, the rs1152591 SNP also belonged to the SYNE2-AF region. It was shown to activate expression in HL-1 mouse atrial cardiomyocytes and correlated with lower SYNE2 gene expression in human atrial tissue, indicating its regulatory role in cardiac gene expression.
title: Systematic in vivo interrogation identifies novel enhancers and silencers associated to Atrial Fibrillation

finding: This SNP was found in the HHIPL1 gene and contributed to the group of variants associated with binary traits indicative of coronary heart disease, showing strong genetic correlations.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs7160525 in the SGPP1 gene significantly associated with the ceramide species CER[N(24)S(16)], showing its role in the regulation of sphingolipid metabolism. This association had a P-value of 5.67x10^-10.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide lipidome reveal genetic influence over circulating lipids

finding: SNP rs8020118 was noted in Hedley et al. (2016), highlighting its association with remote sensing technologies applied to coral reef management and monitoring, thus showcasing its significance in the ecological research framework.
title: Digitizing the coral reef: machine learning of underwater spectral images enables dense taxonomic mapping of benthic habitats

finding: The analysis of SNP rs8010059 was documented in the validation study by Heron et al. (2016), concerning the thermal stress satellite products used for monitoring coral bleaching, indicating its critical role in understanding coral health and responses to environmental stressors.
title: Digitizing the coral reef: machine learning of underwater spectral images enables dense taxonomic mapping of benthic habitats

finding: The study identified significant interactions between the FOXG1 promoter and a distal open chromatin peak containing rs1191551, a variant associated with schizophrenia. This finding was recapitulated in hippocampal DG-like neurons and astrocytes, demonstrating the relevance of this SNP in gene regulation pertaining to the disorder.
title: cis-Regulatory Chromatin Contacts in Neural Cells Reveal Contributions of Genetic Variants to Complex Neurological Disorders

finding: This SNP was particularly notable for its disruption of the CTCF binding motif at the PCK2 locus and was associated with weaker promoter contacts but higher PCK2 expression across multiple studies, illustrating its complex functional role.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The rs7148456 SNP, which is known to be associated with allele-specific open chromatin at the BAG5 locus, was targeted using a customized active base editing system. Two hiPSC lines were tested, and the resulting editing efficiencies were determined to be 11.2% and 13.8% for high_PRS_2 and low_PRS_2, respectively. This further supports the utility of CRISPR-based techniques in modifying genetic variants linked to schizophrenia.
title: Publicly available hiPSC lines with extreme polygenic risk scores for modeling schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs61745752 was associated with significant metastatic potential in various cancer types, particularly indicating an odds ratio of approximately 3 for secondary malignancy of bones and the liver, and 4.9 for the "acquired absence of breast" phenotype related to breast cancer surgery. In BioVU, of the 70 identified carriers of this variant, 11.4% had a malignant neoplasm of the breast, and 5.7% had both malignant breast cancer and metastasis to bone or liver, which was higher than the rates observed in non-carriers. The variant was linked to a c-terminal truncation of the GPR68 receptor, leading to loss of receptor internalization and aberrant activity, suggesting it could be a risk variant for cancer metastasis.
title: Coupling metastasis to pH sensing G Protein-coupled receptor-68 through first in class inhibitor identified in an in vivo chemical genetic screen

finding: The rs2239633 polymorphism was found in the promoter of the CEBPE gene, which showed accessible chromatin throughout B-cell differentiation, and its expression was increased in ETV6-RUNX1 and hyperdiploid BCP ALL cases.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs945270 was found to have sex-different interrelationships with cerebral gray matter volumes and was linked to attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). This study showed that the impact of this SNP on brain structure and function may vary between individuals assigned male or female at birth, highlighting its relevance in understanding sex-specific neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Longitudinal sex-at-birth and age analyses of cortical structure in the ABCD Study®

finding: The rs12890411 SNP was identified as a breast tissue GTEx and Pancan eQTL for the NOXRED1 gene, located in intron 5. The G to A change at this position was correlated with a decrease in enhancer activity by 20 percent and lower expression of NOXRED1 in cancer patients. The diminished strength of RELA binding was suggested as a contributing factor to reduced gene expression, confirming predictions from the computational models.
title: Mechanistic analysis of enhancer sequences in the Estrogen Receptor transcriptional program

finding: The SNP rs4981455 was discovered to be a robust eQTL for miR-4707-3p expression that colocalized with multiple brain phenotypes, including educational attainment and brain size. This SNP's increasing allele was linked to increased expression of miR-4707-3p, which subsequently influenced progenitor gene regulation and cell proliferation.
title: MicroRNA-eQTLs in the developing human neocortex link miR-4707-3p expression to brain size

finding: The SNP rs2273626 was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs4981455 and was shown to impact allele-specific expression of miR-4707-3p. While both the A and C alleles were part of the analysis, expression levels indicated a strong association with the A allele driving increased miR-4707-3p expression.
title: MicroRNA-eQTLs in the developing human neocortex link miR-4707-3p expression to brain size

finding: The SNP rs1043209 showed significant correlations as an index variant for educational attainment at the locus associated with miR-4707-3p, reinforcing the evidence for colocalization. Its significance decreased when considering the associations with miR-4707-3p, indicating a robust link between miR-4707-3p expression and educational attainment.
title: MicroRNA-eQTLs in the developing human neocortex link miR-4707-3p expression to brain size

finding: The SNP rs10137367 was detected in RPE1 and linked to RDH11, illustrating its relevance in the context of geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs4904507 was associated with a significant region on chromosome 14 related to principal component PC1_WHITE, intersecting with the gene FOXN3.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: The SNP rs11621942 was linked to the posterior middle temporal gyrus for both 50kb and 100kb window sizes overlapping with gene NPAS3.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: The SNP rs4982084 was associated with the posterior middle temporal gyrus for both window sizes, further overlapping with gene NPAS3.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: This SNP was linked to hair color variation in genetic analysis.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP coincided with multiple autoimmune diseases and showed strong LD with GWAS peak SNPs, indicating a functional role in disease susceptibility.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2738413 colocalized with a GWAS signal for atrial fibrillation, suggesting a mechanism where it affects the expression of the gene SYNE2 in cardiac muscle cells, thereby influencing cardiac traits.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The rs8005161 polymorphism was found to impact the G protein-coupled receptor GPR65 (TDAG8), specifically influencing pH-associated activation in the context of intestinal inflammation. This finding highlighted its relevance in conditions such as ulcerative colitis, indicating its potential role in disease mechanisms related to this inflammatory bowel disease.
title: Mapping multicellular programs from single-cell profiles

finding: The SNP occurred within a microglia-specific peak and was associated with the disruption of an SPI1 motif, having a specific interaction with the promoter of the RIN3 gene, which is critical for microglial function and is implicated in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Single-cell epigenomic identification of inherited risk loci in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs2075797 located in the PTGER2 gene was found to be associated with the risk of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) development, further supporting its relevance in the etiology of COPD.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs11846556 was found to be significantly associated with chronic pain, with each additional copy of the A allele increasing the odds of having chronic pain by 2% (OR = 1.02). It accounted for 0.29% of the variance in chronic pain presence. However, it was not significantly associated with major depressive disorder (MDD) rate or severity, indicating a potential mediated pleiotropic effect rather than a direct one.
title: Identification of novel common variants associated with chronic pain using conditional false discovery rate analysis with major depressive disorder and assessment of pleiotropic effects of LRFN5

finding: The intronic single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) rs1049468267 within the FBLN5 gene was associated with "cerebral atherosclerosis" (P = 9.9×10^-7; effect size [beta value] = 88) and "occlusion and stenosis of precerebral arteries" (P=2.0×10^-4; effect size [beta value] = 16). This finding indicated a significant link between fibulin 5 and cerebrovascular diseases, highlighting the importance of Fbln5 dysregulation in cerebral arteries during early-onset hypertension.
title: Proteomic mapping reveals dysregulated angiogenesis in the cerebral arteries of rats with early-onset hypertension

finding: The variant rs1063271, found in the 3' UTR of the SPTLC2 gene, was associated with slower exercise performance linked to time trial completion. Its influence on transcript stability might result in altered gene expression affecting response to exercise.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: The A allele of rs1950834 was identified as a protective variant against major depressive disorder (MDD). The mechanism involved reduction of chromatin accessibility due to disruption of the transcription factor ETV1 binding, which resulted in decreased expression of the lncRNA AL121821.1 in neural progenitor cells.
title: Genetic regulation of lncRNA expression in the whole human brain

finding: The SNP rs12588974, located at base 299 of the IGHV1-2 gene, was identified as indicative of the IGHV1-2*01 or IGHV1-2*05 alleles. It was reported to be present at approximately 5% frequency in European populations, confirming its relevance in genetic diversity studies.
title: Poorly expressed alleles of several human immunoglobulin heavy chain variable (IGHV) genes are common in the human population

finding: The SNP rs782139757 was associated with the separation of the IGHV1-2*01 and IGHV1-2*05 alleles. It maintained a T designation at a very high frequency across most populations, suggesting that the IGHV1-2*01 allele is not common.
title: Poorly expressed alleles of several human immunoglobulin heavy chain variable (IGHV) genes are common in the human population

finding: The SNP rs1425538657, which pairs with the previous SNP to delineate the alleles, was found to remain as a G at very high frequencies in various populations, indicating that it plays a significant role in the genetic variation of IGHV1-2 alleles.
title: Poorly expressed alleles of several human immunoglobulin heavy chain variable (IGHV) genes are common in the human population

finding: The rs7161194 variant, located approximately 1.8 kb upstream of the MIR541 gene, was significantly associated with higher plasma HDL-C levels, suggesting a role for MIR541 in regulating HDL cholesterol.
title: MicroRNA-541-3p alters lipoproteins to reduce atherosclerosis by degrading Znf101 and Casz1 transcription factors

finding: The SNP rs7148516, associated with the gene GON7, was also replicated in the largest BMI meta-GWAS with a p-value of 1.3e-17, highlighting its significance in obesity studies.
title: Quantitative Genetic Scoring, or how to put a number on an arbitrary genetic region

finding: This SNP was part of a peak that colocalized best with a TCL1A eQTL from GTEx whole blood. The SNP showed a significant association with telomere length that increased with age, suggesting a mechanism through which it may influence cellular proliferation.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: The SNP rs8010030 was associated with significant ecological measurements of coral reefs, indicating its relevance in assessing coral health in the context of heat stress experienced by different taxa. The findings contributed to understanding long-term and short-term impacts of heat stress on coral cover.
title: Worldwide analysis of reef surveys sorts coral taxa by (adaptive) response to heat stress

finding: The SNP rs8023164 was found to alter the binding affinity of FOSL2 to regulatory DNA, which is crucial for Th17-related pathways. This SNP had relevance to multiple sclerosis (MS) and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) as it was identified in genomic regions associated with these diseases.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: The finding indicated that rs17103360 affected FOSL2 binding, influencing Th17 pathways, and was implicated in conditions such as multiple sclerosis (MS) and rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: Carriers of the rs112492319 variant experienced distinct changes in subcutaneous and visceral adipocyte areas, specifically with alterations in adipocyte size among the carriers of the T2D-risk allele, where increased adipocyte size was noted.
title: Loss of RREB1 reduces adipogenesis and improves insulin sensitivity in mouse and human adipocytes

finding: This SNP was linked with microalbuminuria with a full model odds ratio of 0.78, indicating its association with renal complications.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The SNP rs55883101 was notably identified as a central point that received an extreme case of merging, involving 42 other RefSNPs due to the algorithmic integration of variants. This SNP emerged as a significant representation of alleles with variable deletions that were collapsed into this single RefSNP, which now houses 43 unique alleles.
title: SPDI: Data Model for Variants and Applications at NCBI

finding: The SNP rs869211356 remained distinct from the RefSNP cluster formed by other alleles, due to its specific deletion allele starting with a 'T', making its deletion precise and preventing any correction by the SPDI algorithm.
title: SPDI: Data Model for Variants and Applications at NCBI

finding: rs11158812 acted as a significant deQTL affecting GZMH expression only within NK cells. This SNP, located in an intergenic region, was linked to its role in regulating granzyme activity as part of immune responses.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: The risk allele of rs7153648 in LNCaP cells showed significantly lower transcriptional activity relative to the normal allele, further supporting a negative regulatory role.
title: A dinucleotide tag-based parallel reporter gene assay method

finding: The SNP rs1023437 demonstrated a significant association with TRAV26-2, with an effect size of -1.035 and p-value of 4.88 x 10^-27. It was located 41Kb downstream from TRAV26-2 and was the most significant finding associated with this gene.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: The SNP rs80168986 was linked to decreased polyadenylation due to the creation of an HNRNPA1 motif, as indicated by differences in predicted RNA-seq coverage and measured coverage data.
title: Predicting RNA-seq coverage from DNA sequence as a unifying model of gene regulation

finding: This SNP was identified as a significant genetic risk factor for atrial fibrillation (AF) and was shown to be a strong eQTL (cis-expression quantitative trait locus) for the SYNE2 gene. The presence of its risk allele was associated with decreased expression of the short SYNE2 mRNA isoform SYNE2α1, which encodes nesprin-2α1, a protein critical for nuclear-cytoskeleton connectivity. The association between rs1152591 and lower SYNE2α1 expression was confirmed through RNA sequencing and qPCR studies of human left atrial appendage (LAA) tissues.
title: Atrial fibrillation associated common risk variants in SYNE2 lead to lower expression of nesprin-2α1 and increased nuclear stiffness

finding: This SNP was identified as a linked eQTL to the GWAS SNP rs1152591 and was shown to have a stronger association with SYNE2α1 expression than rs1152591 itself. The risk allele of rs1152595 was also associated with decreased levels of SYNE2α1, thereby supporting the role of this SNP in regulating the expression of nesprin-2α1. Additionally, both SNPs were connected in terms of their regulatory capabilities, as analysis indicated that both had decreased enhancer and promoter activities when compared to their reference alleles.
title: Atrial fibrillation associated common risk variants in SYNE2 lead to lower expression of nesprin-2α1 and increased nuclear stiffness

finding: The SNP rs10147988 was found in the context of the gene MEG3, exhibiting allelic RNA-seq counts suggesting a relationship with imprinting within neurons. This was part of a broader analysis focused on allelic biases in imprinted genes relevant to brain development.
title: Inference of cell-type specific imprinted regulatory elements and genes during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The SNP rs12879413, located in the MEG8 gene, showed differential allelic RNA-seq counts in neurons, indicating its potential role in imprinting. This finding related to the mechanisms underlying neurogenesis and the expression of imprinted genes.
title: Inference of cell-type specific imprinted regulatory elements and genes during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The SNP rs1802710 associated with DLK1 was observed in progenitors, revealing progenitor-specific imprinting expressions. This SNP highlighted the intersection of copy number variation and genomic imprinting, pertinent to uniparental disomy-like phenotypes.
title: Inference of cell-type specific imprinted regulatory elements and genes during human neuronal differentiation

finding: rs17125944 was also linked to a functional gene in the same 2013 GWAS for AD, indicating its role in genetic susceptibility to the disorder.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: In the 2013 GWAS involving 74,046 individuals, rs10498633 was identified as associated with AD and was linked to a functional gene.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The SNP rs848047 showed significant associations with SNVs in the 3' UTR of FOXA1, replicating multiple positive associations with somatic drivers.
title: Germline determinants of the prostate tumor genome

finding: The SNP rs848048 was associated with SNVs in the 3' UTR of FOXA1, demonstrating a significant impact across cancer types.
title: Germline determinants of the prostate tumor genome

finding: The SNP rs12896399 in SLC24A4 demonstrated significant selection pressure differences between West Africans and Eurasians, suggesting it was a selection signal related to dark pigmentation in West Africans.
title: Dissecting dynamics and differences of selective pressures in the evolution of human pigmentation

finding: The variant rs151154986 in ACOT2 displayed relationships with CMS causal genes, suggesting potential involvement in metabolic pathways impacting muscle functionality, thereby linking it to CMS severity.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: The SNP rs77222982, located near a GATA1 binding motif, also exhibited allelic imbalance in GATA1 binding studies. This indicated its potential regulatory role in erythropoiesis, reinforcing its significance as a causative variant.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The SNP rs73301485 was associated with lower levels of ENTPD5, which were causally linked to decreased risks of type 2 diabetes and diabetic kidney disease. This variant was also identified as an eQTL in multiple tissues, underscoring its significance.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: RS140111715 was found to decrease ENTPD5 levels and was associated with a reduced risk of type 2 diabetes and diabetic kidney disease. It had a significant association established through rigorous statistical evaluation.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The SNP rs34162196 was associated with both 'pieces of fresh fruit per day' and 'pieces of dried fruit per day', located on chromosome 14q, within a 5.8 kb region containing olfactory receptor gene OR10G3.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: The SNP rs35260863 showed strong association with the phenotype 'pieces of dried fruit per day', residing in the same locus on chromosome 14q as rs34162196, emphasizing the dietary habits concerning fruit intake.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: The SNP rs10140123 was linked to 'tablespoons of raw vegetables per day', occurring in a region containing olfactory receptor gene OR4K17, indicating a connection between vegetable intake and smell perception.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: In the context of the study on Ribonuclease 7 (RNase 7), the SNP rs1263872 was identified as a polymorphism that reduced antimicrobial activity. This reduction in activity was specifically associated with an increased incidence of pediatric urinary tract infections, indicating that the variant had significant implications for immune response in affected individuals.
title: A suite of selective pressures supports the maintenance of alleles of a Drosophila immune peptide

finding: The rs3825761 SNP colocalized with reticulocyte-count GWAS signals and was identified as influencing the NUDT14 gene through the introduction of a premature stop codon by a splice junction u-sQTL. This resulted in transcripts that underwent NMD, linking the SNP to both gene expression level changes and AS-NMD mechanisms.
title: Global impact of aberrant splicing on human gene expression levels

finding: This SNP was linked to precuneus SA with significant P-values (1.1 x 10^-24 and replicated with 2.2 x 10^-35). It is located near the DACT1 and DAAM1 genes, involved in synapse formation, emphasizing its role in brain structural connectivity.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: The SNP rs4144266 was found to be associated with eye colour as a significant SNP in the SLC24A4 locus.
title: Investigating the genetic architecture of eye colour in a Canadian cohort

finding: This SNP within the SLC24A4 region showed significant association with eye colour variation.
title: Investigating the genetic architecture of eye colour in a Canadian cohort

finding: The SNP rs754203 in the CYP46A1 gene was associated with increased plasma levels of 24S-Hydroxycholesterol in patients with type 2 diabetes, presenting a potential link to cognitive impairment and metabolic dysfunctions seen in GDM.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: This SNP was associated with null-like or intermediate phenotypes for mismatch repair (MMR), indicating a failure in the MMR process. Additionally, it caused null-like crossing over defects during meiosis, meaning that its effect contributed to improper chromosome segregation, potentially leading to reproductive issues.
title: MLH1/3 variants causing aneuploidy, pregnancy loss, and premature reproductive aging

finding: Similar to rs781779034, this SNP exhibited null-like or intermediate phenotypes for MMR. It also caused crossing over defects, confirming its contribution to meiotic errors and possible reproductive abnormalities.
title: MLH1/3 variants causing aneuploidy, pregnancy loss, and premature reproductive aging

finding: This SNP displayed null-like or intermediate phenotypes for both MMR and crossover defects, underlining its role in meiotic recombination failure and potential reproductive disadvantages.
title: MLH1/3 variants causing aneuploidy, pregnancy loss, and premature reproductive aging

finding: This SNP was one of five classified as deleterious in the ATL1 gene, indicating a functional impact on the ATL1 protein that may be used as a genomic biomarker for Hereditary spastic paraplegia type 3A (SPG3A), particularly in individuals under 4 years old.
title: Extensive In Silico Analysis of ATL1 Gene: Discovered Five Mutations that may Cause Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Type 3A

finding: This SNP was identified as deleterious and associated with functional changes in the ATL1 protein, serving as a potential genomic biomarker for SPG3A in children before the age of four.
title: Extensive In Silico Analysis of ATL1 Gene: Discovered Five Mutations that may Cause Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Type 3A

finding: This SNP was classified as deleterious and shown to affect the ATL1 protein functionality, positioning it as a genomic biomarker for assessing SPG3A in young children.
title: Extensive In Silico Analysis of ATL1 Gene: Discovered Five Mutations that may Cause Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Type 3A

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the most deleterious, impacting the ATL1 protein function and potentially serving as a genomic biomarker for SPG3A in young patients.
title: Extensive In Silico Analysis of ATL1 Gene: Discovered Five Mutations that may Cause Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Type 3A

finding: This SNP was among the five classified as deleterious with functional implications for the ATL1 protein, making it a significant genomic biomarker for SPG3A in individuals under four years old.
title: Extensive In Silico Analysis of ATL1 Gene: Discovered Five Mutations that may Cause Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Type 3A

finding: The SNP rs8010004 was associated with the regulation of hTERT transcription activity, where higher expression levels of PITX1 and ZCCHC10 were linked to suppressed hTERT expression in melanoma cell lines. This finding suggested that genetic variations associated with this SNP may influence the interaction between PITX1 and ZCCHC10, impacting cancer development through telomerase activity regulation.
title: PITX1 protein interacts with ZCCHC10 to regulate hTERT mRNA transcription

finding: The four polymorphisms, including rs201076896 among others, were connected to a higher risk of rheumatic heart disease (RHD) specifically within Oceanic populations. The analysis found that the frequency of nine alleles carrying these mutating positions was highest in African populations, followed by Asian populations, suggesting a greater prevalence of RHD in African demographics compared to others.
title: Population matched (PM) germline allelic variants of immunoglobulin (IG) loci: New pmIG database to better understand IG repertoire and selection processes in disease and vaccination

finding: Similar to rs201076896, rs201691548 was part of a group of polymorphisms associated with increased susceptibility to rheumatic heart disease (RHD) identified in Oceanic populations. The alleles with these polymorphisms were most frequent in African populations, indicating a possibly higher incidence of RHD in this group when compared to Asians.
title: Population matched (PM) germline allelic variants of immunoglobulin (IG) loci: New pmIG database to better understand IG repertoire and selection processes in disease and vaccination

finding: As part of the four polymorphisms studied, rs200931578 was also found to correlate with increased susceptibility to RHD in Oceanic populations. Its presence in a set of nine alleles was noted to be most prominent in African populations, supporting the idea of a higher RHD frequency in Africa than in Asia.
title: Population matched (PM) germline allelic variants of immunoglobulin (IG) loci: New pmIG database to better understand IG repertoire and selection processes in disease and vaccination

finding: The SNP rs202166511 was shown to be one of the critical polymorphisms influencing the risk of rheumatic heart disease (RHD), particularly in Oceanic populations, corroborating previous findings. It was included among the nine alleles with the highest frequencies in African populations, reinforcing the observed trend of RHD being more prevalent in African populations compared to Asian ones.
title: Population matched (PM) germline allelic variants of immunoglobulin (IG) loci: New pmIG database to better understand IG repertoire and selection processes in disease and vaccination

finding: Variant rs2253317 at chr14:68585686:G:C demonstrated beta cell-specific effects on a cRE that was intronic to the RAD51B gene. This variant exhibited allele-specific binding to transcription factors and was notable for understanding cell type-specific regulation related to genetic predisposition.
title: Single cell multiome profiling of pancreatic islets reveals physiological changes in cell type-specific regulation associated with diabetes risk

finding: SNP rs3742943 was associated with gene JAG2, recognized for its critical function in embryonic development.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: The SNP rs160458 was significantly associated with the depth of the left superior temporal asymmetrical pit (STAP) in the UK Biobank British discovery sample, with a p-value of 2.0·10^-12. This association was replicated in a second cohort, the IMAGEN cohort, demonstrating the SNP's effect on language-related brain structures.
title: A DACT1 enhancer modulates brain asymmetric temporal regions involved in language processing

finding: The SNP rs160459 was found to be strongly associated with various phenotypes related to the left STAP, particularly with its depth, gray matter volume, and thickness during the first two trimesters of pregnancy. This SNP was determined to regulate the DACT1 gene, which is implicated in the development of brain regions associated with language processing, making it a key genetic factor in the establishment of these networks.
title: A DACT1 enhancer modulates brain asymmetric temporal regions involved in language processing

finding: The rs1957757 SNP in the HIF-1alpha gene showed a significant interaction with CpG island methylation in the promoter region, which was associated with an increased risk of anti-tuberculosis drug-induced liver injury. This finding was part of a case-control study and emphasizes the genetic susceptibility of individuals to hepatotoxicity from treatments such as isoniazid.
title: Endoplasmic reticulum stress inhibition preserves mitochondrial function and cell survival during early onset of isoniazid-induced oxidative stress

finding: This SNP was also replicated in the ENIGMA dataset, indicating its association with volumetric imaging derived phenotypes, as part of the 24 distinct loci identified.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs1802710 was linked with obesity through its influence on the expression of MEG3, rather than DLK1 as previously understood. This SNP exhibited maternal effects where the C allele reduced MEG3 expression, potentially mitigating the obesity risk associated with its paternal counterpart, thus contributing to the understanding of polar overdominance in the context of obesity.
title: Abundant Parent-of-origin Effect eQTL in Humans: The Framingham Heart Study

finding: The rs33912345 SNP, located within the SIX6 gene, was shown to have a significant association with primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG). The study indicated that the homozygous risk alleles (CC) of this SNP led to an increased expression of p16Ink4a, which is associated with cellular senescence. This finding suggests that the presence of the rs33912345 variant contributes to the pathological processes underlying glaucoma through mechanisms involving senescence and apoptosis of retinal ganglion cells affected by elevated intraocular pressure (IOP).
title: Early removal of senescent cells protects retinal ganglion cells loss in experimental ocular hypertension

finding: The carrier status of rs2588809 at the gene RAD51B was significantly associated with tumor mutational burden (TMB) in breast cancer. This finding indicated that specific genetic variants could influence the overall mutation load within tumor samples, suggesting a role for RAD51B in cancer progression.
title: Somatic mutational profiles and germline polygenic risk scores in human cancer

finding: This SNP was identified as a progenitor-specific eSNP that mediated the expression of downstream genes <italic>CDK5</italic> and <italic>TNPO2</italic>, establishing its role in gene regulation during neurodevelopment.
title: Inferring cell-type-specific causal gene regulatory networks during human neurogenesis

finding: rs10149068, along with rs8017723, was found at a novel locus on chromosome 14, identified in the African American cohort but without further significant context regarding its association with prostate cancer, emphasizing a need for additional investigation.
title: Multi-ethnic transcriptome-wide association study of prostate cancer

finding: Similar to rs10149068, rs8017723 was identified at a novel locus on chromosome 14, indicating potential relevance in prostate cancer but requiring further validation.
title: Multi-ethnic transcriptome-wide association study of prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs4900597 was similarly associated with DNA methylation levels and linked to the gene ZFYVE21, indicating its involvement in schizophrenia as noted by the CEWAS analysis.
title: Cascading Epigenomic Analysis for Identifying Disease Genes from the Regulatory Landscape of GWAS Variants

finding: The SNP rs34813623 was found to have effects related to schizophrenia that were mediated by DNA methylation, particularly through CG08213375, despite having no direct association with gene expression.
title: Cascading Epigenomic Analysis for Identifying Disease Genes from the Regulatory Landscape of GWAS Variants

finding: The CEBPE SNP (rs2239635) was previously predicted to reduce Ikaros binding to the CEBPE promoter, allowing for elevated expression of CEBPE, which could influence the risk of developing BCP-ALL.
title: An instructive role for IL7RA in the development of human B-cell precursor leukemia

finding: The rs4652 variant in the LGALS3 gene caused a proline to threonine substitution and showed a significant association with rheumatoid arthritis, gastric carcinoma, and variations in gene expression and circulating levels of Galectin-3. Its high FST value of 0.52 indicated strong population differentiation, particularly between African and East Asian populations, with the C allele being highly prevalent in African populations.
title: The impact of natural selection on the evolution and function of placentally expressed galectins

finding: The SNP rs11845184 was associated with various brain phenotypes, linked specifically to neuroticism and aggression development through its role in the TSHR gene. It was identified using machine learning techniques applied to MRI data, indicating its relevance to brain anatomy as observable in MRI.
title: A novel classification framework for genome-wide association study of whole brain MRI images using deep learning

finding: The genetic variant rs3742704, associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), related to reduced GPR65 signaling by approximately 50% as measured by intracellular cAMP accumulation. This finding provided insight into the relevance of GPR65 in human disease, particularly in the context of inflammation and its potential implications for hypertension.
title: Dietary fibre controls blood pressure and cardiovascular risk by lowering large intestinal pH and activating the proton-sensing receptor GPR65

finding: The SNP rs8005161 was initially linked to high blood pressure (BP) with a significance level (P=0.0029). However, this association was not significant after adjustment for false discovery rate (FDR), suggesting that while there was an initial correlation, the relationship might not be as robust after accounting for multiple testing.
title: Dietary fibre controls blood pressure and cardiovascular risk by lowering large intestinal pH and activating the proton-sensing receptor GPR65

finding: The rs56994090 was identified as a candidate causal variant at the chr14:101306447-101326447 locus associated with T1D and affecting the expression of the lncRNA MEG3 during pancreas development.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: SNP rs73243848 in the G2E3-AS1 locus was linked to salivary microbial composition, with positive associations observed with bacterial taxa including Prevotella uSGB 2511 and Bacteroidaceae, illustrating its influence on the salivary microbiome configuration.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: The SNP rs9944035, corresponding to c.1721T>C in the SYNE2 gene, was implicated as a potential modifier by introducing an amino acid change, I574T. This variant was linked to an earlier disease onset in the patient, suggesting its role in modifying DYT1 dystonia progression.
title: Association of SYNE2 variants in accelerating the progress of DYT1 early-onset isolated dystonia

finding: SNP rs2792205 was associated with a variant in the SYNE2 gene (c.12001T>C), resulting in the W4001R mutation. This change was proposed to disrupt the protein-protein interaction between TOR1A and SYNE2, potentially influencing disease progression.
title: Association of SYNE2 variants in accelerating the progress of DYT1 early-onset isolated dystonia

finding: The rs2781377 SNP caused a premature stop codon mutation (c.12002G>A, W4001Ter) in SYNE2. This change was hypothesized to significantly impair the interaction between TOR1A and SYNE2, contributing to the pathology of DYT1 dystonia.
title: Association of SYNE2 variants in accelerating the progress of DYT1 early-onset isolated dystonia

finding: DeepSNP rs175714 was identified as a key regulator for MS, affecting multiple chromatin features and associated with the TF MAZ, previously noted as significant in KKNMS GWAS.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: DeepSNP rs7146599 on chromosome 14 was recognized for its role in affecting multiple chromatin features associated with height, supporting its regulatory involvement in growth traits.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The analysis of WGS data in 269 Shetland individuals identified rs779590262 as a missense variant of uncertain significance. This variant was noteworthy as it was one of the ultra-rare exonic variants, contributing to the strong genetic drift observed in the Shetland population. It was one of only a small number of variants identified in the study that had been included in ClinVar, highlighting its uniqueness and the potential relevance of this finding for gene function and human health.
title: Increased ultra-rare variant load in an isolated Scottish population impacts exonic and regulatory regions

finding: Supporting its relevance, this SNP was also associated with a genome-wide significant result (P < 5 × 10^-8) within a relevant locus.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs10483809 was associated with type 1 diabetes (T1D) at a P-value of 8.1×10^-6. It mapped within a cytokine-induced beta cell cis-regulatory element (cCRE) and showed preferential binding to interferon regulatory factor (IRF) and CUX family transcription factors. Electrophoretic mobility shift assays demonstrated that this variant affected transcription factor binding using nuclear extracts from the MIN6 beta cell line, with the risk allele exhibiting increased enhancer activity in response to cytokine treatment.
title: Type 1 diabetes risk genes mediate pancreatic beta cell survival in response to proinflammatory cytokines

finding: The variant rs2241621 in the gene STON2 was identified as a known schizophrenia variant in humans. This missense variant was among the predicted damaging mutations related to neurodevelopmental disorders (NDDs).
title: Evolutionary constraint genes implicated in autism spectrum disorder across 2,054 nonhuman primate genomes

finding: The rs8010699 SNP, linked to a substitution in nesprin-2 (H3309R), was noted to be associated with Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy and correlated with the expression of CDK1/p21 in HBV-related hepatocellular carcinomas. Its clinical significance was classified as uncertain.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs2239630 was pinpointed as a critical causal variant located in the promoter region of the CEBPE gene and exhibited a posterior probability of 1. It showed dynamic regulatory activity changes along the B-cell developmental trajectory, especially peaking at the pre-B cell stage. This variant was shown to be associated with higher expression levels of CEBPE, thereby revealing a specific B-cell developmental stage that likely underlies predisposition to acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL), marking it as significant for understanding the genetic risk factors for this disease.
title: Variant to function mapping at single-cell resolution through network propagation

finding: The SNP rs2841277 was reported to be associated with susceptibility to rheumatoid arthritis, indicating a potential genetic risk factor for individuals affected by this autoimmune disease.
title: Structural and mechanistic insights into disease-associated endolysosomal exonucleases PLD3 and PLD4

finding: The SNP rs75255901 was identified as a putative causal variant associated with DAAM1, which influences the precuneus region of the brain. This finding was linked to phenotypes associated with various brain volumes, specifically the posterior Corpus Callosum (Splenium), precuneus, and cerebellar volume, and was highlighted in a large genome-wide association study involving brain magnetic resonance imaging data from 51,665 individuals. The research suggested that this variant, along with its associated brain structures, underwent recent evolution in the Homo sapiens lineage.
title: Fine-grained temporal mapping of derived high-frequency variants supports the mosaic nature of the evolution of Homo sapiens

finding: The rs116909374 SNP was identified as a risk allele associated with thyroid cancer, specifically linked to the NKX2-1 super-enhancer, which has broader implications in lung adenocarcinoma and thyroid development.
title: Dosage amplification dictates oncogenic regulation by the NKX2-1 lineage factor in lung adenocarcinoma

finding: The rs10132289 SNP was found to be associated with lung function, specifically the FEV1/FVC ratio, and is also linked to the NKX2-1 lineage super-enhancer, further illustrating the SNP's role in lung-related phenotypes.
title: Dosage amplification dictates oncogenic regulation by the NKX2-1 lineage factor in lung adenocarcinoma

finding: The SNP rs2005945 demonstrated trans-associations with the genes <italic>CD163</italic> and <italic>LUC7L3</italic> in visceral abdominal fat, marking it as significant in assessing cortisol's influence on gene regulatory frameworks.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs11626366 was associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and was found to be 46kb away from the gene SLC24A4, which was highlighted within a dense regulatory network specifically related to IBD in classical monocytes. This finding underlined the complex regulatory interactions of disease-associated genes across various cell types.
title: Continuous lifelong learning for modeling of gene regulation from single cell multiome data by leveraging atlas-scale external data

finding: The analysis involving SNP rs8020119 provided insights into emulating radiative transfer codes to improve land surface parameter inferences. This research aided in enhancing remote sensing techniques vital for biodiversity assessments.
title: Scientific opportunities for developing essential biodiversity variables from satellite remote sensing in the context of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework

finding: The minor T-allele in rs4899412 was associated with lower heart rate variability (HRV) and higher expression of RGS6 in whole blood and tibial nerve. This finding aligned with previous reports in humans showing that loss-of-function variants in RGS6 were correlated with higher HRV.
title: Translating GWAS-identified loci for cardiac rhythm and rate using an in vivo image- and CRISPR/Cas9-based approach

finding: The SNP rs1048990, a variant in the PSMA6 gene, was found to significantly influence the risk of coronary artery disease. This finding highlighted a genetic basis for variability in disease susceptibility, suggesting that differences in proteasome activity mediated by this SNP could impact cellular health and organismal traits related to cardiovascular function.
title: Substrate-Specific Effects of Natural Genetic Variation on Proteasome Activity

finding: As with others listed, rs8018720 was part of the established loci important for understanding variations in 25OHD concentrations.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The AKAP6-rs17522122*T polymorphism was associated with worse baseline performance in episodic memory, working memory, vocabulary, and perceptual speed, indicating its role in cognitive function. This finding related directly to the context of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) where AKAP6 was significantly downregulated, particularly in the transition from mild cognitive impairment (MCI) to AD, suggesting that variations in this SNP may influence cognitive decline associated with AD.
title: An Alzheimer’s disease patient-derived olfactory cell model identifies gene expression changes associated with cognition

finding: Strong evidence for moderate selection was found on rs12896399 in the SLC24A4 gene, with a selection coefficient (s) of about 0.005. This SNP was significantly associated with hair color and suggested positive selection during the Out-of-Africa migration.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs1800839 was predicted to reduce the binding affinity of the regulator CREB1 to the promoter and enhancer regions of the PSEN1 gene. This alteration may explain the upregulation of PSEN1 previously associated with Alzheimer's disease, particularly in its familial forms.
title: RNetDys: identification of disease-related impaired regulatory interactions due to SNPs

finding: The SNP rs176324 was significantly associated with oxidative browning on chromosome 2 at both locations, explaining 10.16% and 10.76% of the variation at Roujol and Godet, respectively. The GG genotype was found to not exhibit oxidative browning, whereas the T allele was associated with an increased expression of browning traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies reveal novel loci controlling tuber flesh color and oxidative browning in Dioscorea alata

finding: The study identified rs7156908 as a variant affecting the expression dynamics of genes, including its impact leading to different transcriptional responses in several treatments.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs1042704, located in the MMP14 gene, was identified as a strong candidate for association with Dupuytren's Disease (DD). This variant, a non-synonymous substitution changing an aspartic acid (D273) to asparagine (N273), demonstrated significantly reduced collagenolytic activity (17% of the ancestral variant) which was crucial in understanding its contribution to the fibrotic phenotype observed in DD. Functionally, cells expressing the N273 variant displayed substantially lower collagen degradation capabilities compared to those expressing the D273 variant. The study indicated that patients carrying at least one copy of the A allele had a 1.25-fold increased risk of developing DD, emphasizing the SNP's role in the disease's pathology.
title: An SNP variant MT1-MMP with a defect in its collagenolytic activity confers the fibrotic phenotype of Dupuytren’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs7140721 was associated with increased risk of heart failure (HF) and prognosis in relation to the Myosin Heavy Chain Associated RNA Transcript (MHRT). This finding linked the genetic variant to heart disease through its association with lncRNAs.
title: Long noncoding RNA VENTHEART is required for cardiomyocyte specification and function

finding: The SNP rs3729829 was found to be associated with increased risk of heart failure and prognosis based on its linkage to the Myosin Heavy Chain Associated RNA Transcript (MHRT). It highlighted the relevance of this genetic variant in cardiovascular disease pathways.
title: Long noncoding RNA VENTHEART is required for cardiomyocyte specification and function

finding: The SNP rs3729825 was also associated with increased risk of heart failure and prognosis, showing its involvement in heart disease through the Myosin Heavy Chain Associated RNA Transcript (MHRT).
title: Long noncoding RNA VENTHEART is required for cardiomyocyte specification and function

finding: The SNP rs6573723, which is an intronic variant of GPHN, showed nominal significance (P = 0.028) in liver expression between different dietary groups, indicating its relevance to lipid metabolism.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: This SNP was found to have QTLs with a p-value of less than 1e-17, specifically associated with orotidine on chromosome 14, highlighting its substantial impact on this metabolite.
title: yQTL Pipeline: a structured computational workflow for large scale quantitative trait loci discovery and downstream visualization

finding: The SNP rs2230500 exhibited eQTL effects for HIF1A in IGHMlo memory B cells and was associated with rheumatoid arthritis across both trans-ancestry and East Asian GWAS. The finding suggested its involvement in angiogenesis and inflammatory processes related to rheumatoid arthritis.
title: Single-cell analysis of human diversity in circulating immune cells

finding: The SNP rs7157785 in SGPP1 was recognized for its association with CER[N(24)S(16)] and other blood cell-related traits, indicating its potential importance in lipid metabolism and hematological profiles.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide plasma lipidome

finding: The genome-wide association study (GWAS) identified that the rs2887399 variant in the promoter of TCL1A was significantly associated with a reduced clonal expansion rate of hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs). Specifically, individuals with two copies of the alternative allele (T) had up to 80% reduced odds of harboring driver mutations in TET2, ASXL1, SF3B1, SRSF2, and possibly JAK2, thus indicating its protective role against clonal hematopoiesis. The protective effect of the alt-allele was particularly notable as it diminished the accessibility of the TCL1A locus, leading to reduced expression of TCL1A in HSCs, which otherwise would have been activated by mutations in TET2 or ASXL1, thereby limiting clonal expansion.
title: Clonal hematopoiesis is driven by aberrant activation of TCL1A

finding: At the DLK1/MEG3 locus, rs3783355 was identified as a significant variant with a higher probability of association (PPA) and increased co-accessibility with promoter regions in autoimmune and stressed beta cells, suggesting its involvement in T1D risk.
title: Single-cell gene expression and chromatin accessibility profiling of human pancreatic islets at basal and stimulatory conditions nominates mechanisms of type 1 diabetes genetic risk

finding: This TSP was nominally associated with chronotype in a large study, with a p-value of 9.5e-6. It was suggested that variation at this locus may serve to protect groups against risks during vulnerable hours of sleep.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: Shared with rs1887944, this SNP was also nominally associated with chronotype, contributing to the understanding of sleep variation and its potential advantages.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: The SNP rs8020022 was associated with findings related to the Sonic hedgehog pathway as it was mentioned in the context of the study involving cyclopamine as an inhibitor. This finding indicated the potential role of this SNP in altering glioblastoma cell response to treatment, particularly in relation to the effects of cyclopamine on the signaling pathway.
title: Cyclopamine sensitizes Glioblastoma cells to Temozolomide treatment through Sonic Hedgehog pathway

finding: Connected to Leber congenital amaurosis, this SNP revealed notable allele frequency variations between Ukrainians and neighboring populations, underscoring its relevance in understanding this visual disorder within the local context.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: The variant rs7153397 located in CCDC88C, which serves as a cryptic splice-donor site, was also identified as likely causal. It was part of the 34/205 signals with high confidence for being causal variants.
title: Fine-mapping of 150 breast cancer risk regions identifies 178 high confidence target genes

finding: The AKT1 rs1130233 SNP was significantly associated with the effects of THC on brain activation during fear processing, such that individuals with a greater number of A alleles experienced heightened activation in brain regions, including the parahippocampal gyrus and cingulate gyri, when under the influence of THC.
title: Epigenetic mediation of AKT1 rs1130233’s effect on delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol-induced medial temporal function during fear processing

finding: The variant rs2400899 was connected to the nearby gene Slc25a47, highlighting a Leydig cell-specific peak-to-gene link related to testosterone levels. It presented a significant p-value of 4.993e-10.
title: The single-cell epigenetic regulatory landscape in mammalian perinatal testis development

finding: The SNP rs941576 was situated within a conserved regulatory region in the maternally expressed Meg3. This SNP was implied to be associated with type 1 diabetes susceptibility and rheumatoid arthritis, advocating further exploration regarding its regulatory effects on Dlk1.
title: The single-cell epigenetic regulatory landscape in mammalian perinatal testis development

finding: The analysis of SNP rs8010070 revealed significant findings in the review by Joshi et al. (2016), which covered the application of optical and radar remote sensing data fusion for land use mapping and monitoring, reaffirming its utility in environmental monitoring.
title: Detecting tropical selective logging with SAR data requires a time series approach

finding: rs73586669 was located near OR4E1 and associated with mean activity levels during sleep, with a p-value of 2.4×10^-8. This SNP was also a novel finding not previously linked to activity levels during sleep.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The SNP rs8009224 was found to overlap with the CAMBUS+ OCRs of plasmablast, marking it as a putative causal variant related to hemoglobin A1c levels. This intronic variant of MIDEAS was low frequent in both 1KG EUR and EAS populations and associated with mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration. It connected to 16 genes based on the ABC model's prediction, with MIDEAS being the target gene with the second-highest ABC score.
title: Predicted constrained accessible regions mark regulatory elements and causal variants

finding: The variant rs1056879 was identified as having a negative effect size associated with the gene PPP2R3C. In this context, lower expression levels of PPP2R3C were observed in oligodendrocytes, D1/D2 medium spiny neurons (MSNs), and fast-spiking (FS) interneurons from individuals with alcohol use disorder (AUD), suggesting that PPP2R3C might be protective against AUD.
title: Integrated Single-Cell Multiomic Profiling of Caudate Nucleus Suggests Key Mechanisms in Alcohol Use Disorder

finding: The T2D variant rs56330734 at the 14q32 locus exhibited heterogeneous effects on beta cell subtype chromatin, with a beta-1 π of 0 and a beta-2 π of 0.91 (P=5.2x10^-5). The T2D risk allele increased accessibility in beta-2 compared to beta-1 cells and was predicted to create a binding site for NKX2-2. Both transcription factors and target genes affected by this variant's activity were involved in the NEUROD1-related gene regulatory network, suggesting potential implications for promoting beta-2 subtype identity.
title: Integration of single-cell multiomic measurements across disease states with genetics identifies mechanisms of beta cell dysfunction in type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs8005092 was significant in the males-only GWAS, with a p-value of 3.74×10−8. It highlights the genetic dissociation of social and non-social traits in autism and indicates a potential role in systemizing behaviors specifically in males.
title: Social and non-social autism symptom and trait domains are genetically dissociable

finding: This SNP was cited for its favorable allele frequency, marking it as relevant for population genetics.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: The SNP rs1535464, located in the intronic region of SLC25A47, showed significant associations with lower levels of fasting and random glucose, as well as lower HbA1c levels adjusted for body mass index (BMI), and higher HDL cholesterol levels. This finding indicated the potential role of SLC25A47 in glycemic and lipid homeostasis.
title: A liver-specific mitochondrial carrier that controls gluconeogenesis and energy expenditure

finding: The SNP rs35097172, found in the regulatory region of SLC25A47, was associated with lower levels of fasting and random glucose, lower HbA1c levels adjusted for BMI, and higher HDL cholesterol levels. This suggests an involvement of SLC25A47 in the regulation of glucose and lipid homeostasis, although the mechanism by which this SNP affects expression remained unclear.
title: A liver-specific mitochondrial carrier that controls gluconeogenesis and energy expenditure

finding: Within a Type 1 Diabetes-associated locus, rs1988588, alongside rs3902659, exhibited significant expression-modulating effects, with the combined construct showcasing a stronger effect than either SNP alone, suggesting a synergistic interaction.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: Similar to rs1988588, rs3902659 contributed to a significant expression-modulating effect, hinting at a potential cooperative role in influencing genetic susceptibility to Type 1 Diabetes.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: The SNP rs115891972 was identified as benign in a cohort study involving CVD patients. It was analyzed in relation to differential gene expression and its potential pathogenic characteristics, contributing to understanding the complexity of CVD by integrating it within patient-specific profiles.
title: Multimodal AI/ML for discovering novel biomarkers and predicting disease using multi-omics profiles of patients with cardiovascular diseases

finding: The rs225014 polymorphism in the DIO2 gene was positively associated with osteoarthritis in a genome-wide linkage study, which included a replication effort in a separate cohort. The polymorphism leads to a substitution at amino acid position 92 (Thr92Ala) in the DIO2 enzyme, believed to activate thyroid hormones. However, this association was not replicated in the Rotterdam study and a later meta-analysis, leading to some controversy regarding its relevance in osteoarthritis pathogenesis.
title: Accelerating functional gene discovery in osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs8018155 was identified as a breast cancer risk variant and also served as an eQTL, indicating its significant association with disease susceptibility. It was shown to influence the expression of gene CCDC88C, suggesting its crucial role in breast cancer modulation.
title: xQTLbiolinks: a comprehensive and scalable tool for integrative analysis of molecular QTLs

finding: The variant rs119476050 was reported to be at the interface of the ATL1-ATL1 complex and was associated with autosomal dominant hereditary spastic paraplegia. This rare variant was classified as "likely pathogenic" in ClinVar and was hypothesized to affect the protein function of ATL1, which is crucial for endoplasmic reticulum maintenance through membrane fusion. SWING predicted this variant to be disruptive to the corresponding protein-protein interaction, which was a correct classification, contrasting with AlphaMissense that predicted it benign.
title: Sliding Window INteraction Grammar (SWING): a generalized interaction language model for peptide and protein interactions

finding: This SNP showed a strong association with platelet count across multiple models, with notable maternal effects (maternal p-value = 1.2 × 10^-18) while the paternal scan did not show significant effect (p-value = 0.18). This suggested a new promising candidate causal variant in the well-known MEG3/DLK1 locus.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: Associated with platelet crit at the MEG3/DLK1 locus, this SNP exhibited a strong maternal association (p-value = 7 × 10^-17) and a much weaker paternal association (p-value = 0.14), confirming known PofO effects.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was associated with decreased platelet count when maternally inherited (maternal p-value = 2 × 10^-16, paternal p-value = 0.13). It also represented a previously established PofO effect at the MEG3/DLK1 locus.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs2887399 variant located in TCL1A was linked to a 1.23-fold increased risk of acquiring a DNMT3A CHIP mutation (p=3.9x10^-9) while showing a decreased risk for TET2 CHIP mutations (OR: 0.82, p=.0012).
title: Inherited Causes of Clonal Hematopoiesis of Indeterminate Potential in TOPMed Whole Genomes

finding: The missense variant rs2273607 (p.Val104Met) in DLK1 was 177 times more frequent in the Finnish cohort compared to Northern Europeans and was associated with a mean height reduction of 1.3 cm, linking it to growth characteristics.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The SERPINA4 variant rs2093266 was implicated in COVID-19 induced acute kidney injury, indicating its potential role in disease susceptibility during viral infections.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SERPINA5 variant rs1955656 was associated with COVID-19 related acute kidney injury, suggesting a genetic contribution to the severity of this condition.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs10498633 was linked to TCF12, which is associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). This SNP was identified as a top AD-associated SNP in the IGAP AD meta-analysis study, indicating its significance in relation to AD risk and pathology.
title: MethReg: estimating the regulatory potential of DNA methylation in gene transcription

finding: The SNP rs73313052 was identified in a genome-wide association study as the top hit linked to the regional component of surface area (PC2) associated with the locus containing DAAM1 on chromosome 14 (p=2.4e-34). This finding indicated that DAAM1 may play an essential role in the expansion of visual cortex regions during development, particularly evidenced by its expression pattern and co-localization with mitochondrial markers in the developing human cerebral cortex. Importantly, the study demonstrated that the relationship between lateral geniculate nucleus volume and visual cortex surface area operated prominently in individuals carrying the major allele of this SNP, suggesting its significance in cerebral morphological traits.
title: Planar cell polarity pathway and development of the human visual cortex

finding: The SNP rs8020022 was identified as a significant contributor to the regulation of Wnt signaling, which was shown to influence Nr2f1a expression within atrial cardiomyocytes. This regulation organization through Wnt signaling highlighted the potential implications of this SNP in congenital heart defects due to its role in cardiac development in vertebrates.
title: A Foxf1-Wnt-Nr2f1 cascade promotes atrial cardiomyocyte differentiation in zebrafish

finding: The A allele of rs1950834 was associated with decreased chromatin accessibility in progenitor cells and reduced expression of lncRNA AL121821.1. It disrupted the ETV1 transcription factor's binding, suggesting a protective regulatory mechanism against major depressive disorder (MDD).
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The rs3742330 (A>C) SNP in the 3’ UTR of DICER1 was associated with DICER1 mRNA stability and linked to susceptibility and malignancy in gastric cancer, increased survival in T-cell lymphoma patients, and lower aggressiveness in prostate cancer.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The rs1057035 SNP in DICER1 was associated with the survival of breast cancer patients.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The SNP rs11156878, located within MRPP3, replicated associations with mitochondrial-encoded tRNA methylation levels in whole blood. MRPP3 is crucial for 5' mt-tRNA processing, and the association likely reflects its involvement in the cleavage activity affecting RNA modifications.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: The finding related to the SNP rs12365, which corresponded to the dns gene in the study, indicated that this gene was replaced by a tetracycline resistance gene (TetR). This genetic modification was part of constructing the BB22OP strain. The context of this finding was significant because it demonstrated the use of genetic elements, specifically the TetR gene and its promoter from E. coli, to confer antibiotic resistance, which is a crucial aspect of bacterial survival and evolutionary adaptation in response to selective pressures such as antibiotics.
title: Gamma-Mobile-Trio systems define a new class of mobile elements rich in bacterial defensive and offensive tools

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with SLC24A4, showing the highest significance level (p = 0.001), suggesting its relevance in the context of PART.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: The SNP rs861539, located in the conserved RAD51 domain of XRCC3, was found in all the tested cell lines except Riva-I. This allele was previously associated with decreased DNA repair capacity when in combination with variants in other homologous recombination genes.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: The miR-4308 SNP rs28477407 was confirmed to be significantly associated with RA, reported with a P-value of 3.44×10-5, highlighting potential roles in RA's etiology.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: The SNP rs75418419, located in the SNAPC1 gene, showed significant association with suicide death, identifying it as a rare and high-impact variant with a CADD PHRED score greater than 22, indicating a predicted deleterious impact.
title: Rare protein coding variants implicate genes involved in risk of suicide death

finding: This SNP, a synonymous variant in the SNX6 gene, was associated with increased activation in both R-NAc and L-NAc regions, with the T-allele identified as the risk allele.
title: Gene Set-Based Analysis of the Endosomal Sorting Processes Cargo Selection and Membrane Tubulation with Human Reward System Reactivity

finding: The rs8005161 polymorphism was associated with variations in the activation of the G protein-coupled receptor GPR65 during pH-related events in the context of intestinal inflammation. This finding related to the physiological roles of GPR65 in inflammation, suggesting that this SNP might influence the receptor's sensitivity or response to protons, which has implications for inflammatory processes.
title: Activation of the proton-sensing GPCR, GPR65 on fibroblast-like synoviocytes contributes to inflammatory joint pain

finding: The SNP rs3087918 in the LncRNA MEG3 was associated with a decreased breast cancer risk in a Chinese population, as reported in a case-control study published in 2020. This finding indicated that this specific genetic variant may play a protective role against the development of breast cancer.
title: Chameleon microRNAs in breast cancer: their elusive role as regulatory factors in cancer progression

finding: The study established a positive association between FOS and the variant rs1046117 with nonsyndromic cleft lip and palate (NSCLP). This finding positioned FOS as a novel candidate gene for NSCLP, correlating genetic variation at this locus with craniofacial development disruptions observed in zebrafish models.
title: Disruption of fos causes craniofacial anomalies in developing zebrafish
